loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
Benedicta P. de 46 años, es presidenta de la Asociación Comunal San Juan, que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Panamericana. Benedicta se dedica a vender  verduras en diferentes ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, una de ellas es el mercado San Felipe, ella vende hace 5 años aproximadamente por la necesidad de solventar los gastos de su familia el cual está conformado por 11 integrantes.

Benedicta necesita el préstamo para adquirir mercadería y seguir generando ingresos. También indica que a ella le gusta la forma de trabajo que se tiene en Pro Mujer, sobre todo el ahorro, además visita con relativa frecuencia al consultorio porque le dan un trato caluroso.

Las demás integrantes de esta Asociación Comunal tienen variados negocios que se dedican al comercio, producción y servicio, todas necesitan el préstamo para invertir en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Benedicta P. is 46 years old and the president of the San Juan Communal Association which is part of the Centro Focal Panamericana. Benedicta sells vegetables in different markets around the city of El Alto. One of these markets is the Mercado San Felipe. Due to the necessity of paying for family expenses, she has been selling at markets for approximately the past 5 years. Her family consists of 11 people. Benedicta requires the loan in order to acquire merchandise and continue to generate income. She also indicates that she likes the type of work that they have to do at Pro Mujer , especially the savings. In addition, she regularly visits the consulting office because they treat her so warmly. The women members of this communal association have a variety of businesses, both production-based and service-based. They all require the loan in order to invest in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia C., 36, is from the city of Tagbilaran. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. Cecilia owns & operates a store where she sells seafood products including dried fish and shrimp. Cecilia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

Cecilia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Cecilia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Cecilia from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business and supplement her family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings,insurance and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jeanne D'arc

texts.en:
Jeanne D’Arc is married and has two children.  One of her children is 11 months old and the other is 3 years and five months old and is in school.  Her husband works with a micro-finance bank.  

She owns a store that carries scholastic materials for primary and secondary students.  She is requesting a loan to increase the selection of scholastic items she sells. She says that her business is well-known because of her good customer care. She has been in  this business for three years. She plans to save enough so that she can buy her own house one day.

loans.use: Buying more scholastic materials

loans.name: Ana Justina

texts.es:
Ana de 45 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil, (zona urbana, la mayoría de los habitantes son comerciantes informales),  ella tiene una tienda surtida, vende panes, víveres y algunos artículos de papelerías. 

Cuando comenzó solo vendía panes a sus vecinos y conocidos pero como le pedían mas productos empezó a comprar víveres, hasta que su pequeña panadería se convirtió en una tienda, durante esos años ha venido trabajando desde las 05:30 hasta las 23:00pm todos los días, con la ayuda de su esposo se levantan todos los días para atender la tienda. 

Para poder surtir mas la tienda ella quiere comprar con el préstamo un congelador, lácteos. en el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio para incrementar las ventas.
texts.en:
Ana, 45, lives in Guasmo, Guayaquil (an urban zone whose residents are informal merchants for the most part). She has a general store where she stocks baked goods, groceries and some stationery items. When she started out she only sold bread to her neighbors and acquaintances. However, due to their requesting other items, she started to buy groceries until her small bakery turned into a store. During these years she has worked from 5:30am until 11pm every day. She and her husband, who helps out in the store, get up every day to tend to it. In order to stock it better, she wants to use the loan to buy a freezer and dairy products. In the future, she’d like to enlarge her store so that sales will increase.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For a freezer and dairy products.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida A. is from the village of Montaña Vista, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 55 years old. Adelaida is separated from her spouse and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Adelaida owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Adelaida has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Adelaida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Adelaida is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise & sell in future. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Adelaida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise & sell in the future

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is 30 years old and lives in the historic city of Lahore, Pakistan.  he lives in a small home with her husband and two children in the area of Yadgar. Both of her children are sons; they are very young and have not started attending school yet. Her husband is a rickshaw driver. He works very hard to put three meals on the table. Her father also lives with her and works in a factory for a low income.

Nasreen makes artificial flowers on order. She was doing this before her marriage (for 14 years); when she was very young, she learned this art from her mother. 
 
Nasreen has applied for a loan from Asasah for her artificial flower business. With the loan, she will buy the raw materials such as artificial flower petals and plastic sticks in large quantities, and she will hire a worker to  assist her in making artificial flowers to fulfill larger orders on time.  She will train the assistant about flower making. 

She hopes that she will be able to increase her income by making these changes to her business and thereby improve her family's living standard. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and is a responsible loan user of Asasah.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for making artificial flowers

loans.name: Juan De La Cruz

texts.es: El Sr. Juan de la C. S. C.   él  se desempeña  como Tractorista en el hotel Barceló Monte limar, tiene  doce años de trabajar para esta institución, es casado actualmente. Ha tenido  dos  créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación, los créditos con CEPRODEL le han beneficiado mucho ya que de esa manera él  ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Juan de la C. S. C. works as a tractor driver at the Barceló Montelimar Hotel. He has worked here for twelve years. He is currently married. Juan has had two loans with Ceprodel and has used them to buy construction materials to improve his house. The Ceprodel loans have helped him greatly because with them he has improved living conditions for himself and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase roofing materials: Zinc, perlins, sand, cement, etc.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena Nuñez is a 45-year old married woman who supports her family by operating a business venture; a dress shop  business.  She lives in Purok 1, Brgy. 2, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her dress shop business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP9,000. 

Ma. Elena is now borrowing  PHP15,000 so that she  could  purchase raw materials. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP25,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Elena aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.

About NWTF:  
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta P. is 53 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. She is from the village of Del Pilar in the municipality of Cabatuan in Isabela province on the Luzon islands. Julieta runs a general store from which she sells a variety of different products to the local community. She has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Julieta joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan, her first, of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a farmer from Nyamira town in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for 12 years and employs one farmhand. His mixed farm produces bananas, tea, maize, and eggs, all of which he sells at the local market. He also earns income from his lumbering business. His biggest challenges have been the diseases that affect his crops as well as the lack of a ready market for his products.

He has requested this loan of 25,000KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help in paying school fees for his children and improving the livelihood of his family. In future, he would like to expand his farming by purchasing more land and acquiring at least three more dairy cows. 

Thomas is 47 years old. He is married and has been blessed with three children who are between the ages of 17 and 27. Two of the children are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Esta clienta es vendedora de verduras en el mercado central de la ciudad tiene un pequeño lugar en la que oferta sus productos en canastos. 
Tiene 15 años de experiencia en la venta de verduras y esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de verduras que se vende mas para las comidas de navidad y fin de años que es cuando se mejoran las ventas.
Y de esa maneras mantener a sus 2 hijos y que trabajan junto a ella
texts.en: This client sells vegetables in the central market in the city. She has a small place where she sells her product from baskets. She has been selling vegetables for the past fifteen years. She is asking for this loan in order to buy vegetables as she sells more vegetables at this time of year.  The vegetables will be used for Christmas and New Year’s meals. This time of year is when her sales improve. She uses this job to support her two children. The children work with her.

loans.use: She will buy vegetables for the Christmas season

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús, de 25 años, es un hombre joven y con muchas aspiraciones. Junto a Cesi, de 21 años, cuidan de su hija, Maribel de 1 año de nacida. Los tres como una gran familia viven juntos, en casa de sus padres, ubicada en la localidad de Casacoto. A pesar de las nuevas responsabilidades, que tiene, él no se amilana, ya tiene 6 años dedicándose a la agricultura, por ello; “no es algo nuevo para mí”, afirma. Y tiene mucha razón, ya que Jesús, es respetado en su localidad; ahí sus cultivos de papa, en grandes extensiones, son los más cotizados en el mercado central de su ciudad. Lo que más le gusta a él, es poder ayudar a los padres de Cesi, todos los días junto a ellos, se encamina a cuidar de sus sembríos, los cuida y aplica abono con mucho cuidado. Pero como ya tiene familia; ahora el quiere sacarlos adelante y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida; por ello esta juntando dinero para abrir una pequeña tienda de comestibles, donde está seguro podrá tener mayor ingresos.Es el primer crédito con MFP y está  feliz de trabajar en su banco comunal, que es muy respetado en la zona; en donde augura muchos éxitos. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá obtener varios sacos de abono, para poder nivelar su producción de papa, que en este mes cosechará.
texts.en:
Jesús is 25 years old.  He is a young man with many aspirations.  Together with 21 year-old Cesi, he looks after his daughter Maribel who is 1 year old.  The three of them live together in her parents' home which is located in the town of Casacoto.

In spite of the new responsibilities which he has, he is not discouraged because he has been farming for 6 years. “It isn't new for me” he confirms.  And he is indeed very right since Jesús is respected in his town.  His potato crops are the most sought after in his town's central market.  What he most likes is being able to help Cesi's parents.  Every day, alongside them, he goes off to looks after his crops.  He tends to them and applies fertilizer very carefully.  However, as he now has a family he would like to help them get ahead and provide them with a better quality of life.  For this reason, he is gathering together money to open a small grocery store from which he is certain that he will be able to make better profits.

This is Jesús' first loan from MFP and he is happy to be working with his community bank which is very respected in the district.  As a member of the bank, he predicts a lot of success.  He will use the loan he is requesting to obtain several sacks of fertilizer for his potato crop which he will harvest this month.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer for his potato crop

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is a young wife from Ramallah. Her husband owns a bedroom accessories boutique in the old city of Ramallah. Rana and her husband started the store two years ago.

Rana came to FATEN and took a $2000 loan to purchase goods to sell in the store. They sell sheets, duvets, pillows covers, etc.

Rana's husband appears in the picture here in the store as Rana is a religious woman and doesn't want her picture online.

loans.use: To purchase boutique bedroom accessories

loans.name: Teresa Nelli

texts.es: Teresa Nelli se dedica a la venta de cereales entre otras cosas. Ella es una persona muy bien conocida en su vivienda en donde ofrece una gran variedad de sus productos. La Señora inicio con recursos propios este negocio lo inicio con ayuda de sus hijas ya que ellas le ayudaban en la venta y a iniciar con el poco capital que poseían. La experiencia que han tenido ha sido gratificante por lo que se siente orgullosa de tener este medio de vida. El financiamiento es para la compra de cereales, pinol, pinolillo entre otros.
texts.en: Teresa Nelli sells grains and other items. She is a very well-known person in her building, where she offers a large variety of products. She started this business with her own resources and the help of her daughters, since they helped her with the sales and start-up with the little capital that they had. Teresa´s experience has been rewarding, and she is proud to have this way of life. This loan is for the purchase of grains, pinol [flour made from toasted maize], and cornstarch, among other items.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Maana

texts.en:
Maana A. has a provision store at Ankaful near Abura. Maana has received no formal education.  She is married and has 4 children.  Maana has been selling provisions for 4 years now. She is responsible for assisting her husband in the payment of the family's bills.

Her loan will be used to buy a variety of provisions for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest into the provision business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of provisions for resale.

loans.name: Rutigana

texts.en:
P. is 22 years old and single. P. is commonly known in the business of selling cows and he has been in this business for two years. He employs two people to help him. P. works from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day.

P. has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to additional cows for sale. With these additional cows, P. will hopefully earn more profits and these profits will allow him to keep reinvesting in his business of selling cows. P. will also start saving for a better future and saving to build his house.

loans.use: Additional cows for sale

loans.name: Godiano

texts.en:
Godiano is a 41-year-old, married man with five children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in the motor vehicle business for the last eight years, during which time he was driving other people’s vehicles and now he drives his own. His hardship is high fuel prices and his vision is to have three motor vehicles plus educating his children.

Godiano needs the loan to buy an engine for his taxi.

loans.use: Buying an engine for the motor vehicle

loans.name: Gerardo Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Gerardo Antonio B. L. él es trabajador activo de la Empresa “CEMEX” desempeñándose como obrero tiene  cuatro   años de trabajar para esta institución, es casado actualmente tiene dos hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como, Arena, Cemento, piedra, piedrín etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Sr. Gerardo Antonio B. L. is an active employee of the CEMEX Company where he has worked as a laborer for four years.  He is married and currently has two children who are in school.  Gerardo has received two loans from CEPRODEL and each one was used to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, and other items so that he could expand and improve his home.  The loans from CEPRODEL have been a great benefit since they have enabled him to improve the living conditions for himself and his family.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for home improvements

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To increase the stock of charcoal

loans.name: Kaneez's Group

texts.en:
Kaneez has been living in Sahiwal for the past 15 years with her family in a single-room brick house. Sahiwal is a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture and cattle farming. She is 42 years of age and has given birth to two sons and two daughters. All of them are enrolled in a local school getting their education. Her husband’s name is A. H. and he is a blacksmith by profession. He makes iron boxes (used to keep clothes, quilts and blankets and usually used in houses) and sells through his shop. He is an expert and has a good name in this industry in his area. Kaneez herself is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is a very supportive lady and tries her best to provide relief to her family with her work. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. He will use the loan money to purchase iron and other required materials in larger quantities to make a larger number of iron boxes. This will help him fulfill orders on time and make more profit. Kaneez is confident that an investment in her husband’s business will be a good step towards its growth and her family will be able to have a better standard of life as a result. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Kaneez”.

loans.use: To buy iron and other required materials

loans.name: Bok Xalat Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOK XALAT est créé le 04 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 10 femmes issues du même quartier. Elles ont formé leur groupe par affinité et par proximité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de SANTHIABA SUD

Madame FATMA THIOUBOU D. (debout à droite de la photo, vêtue de bleu avec une écharpe blanche) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 59 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants. 

Elle fait une petit commerce de produits divers. Elle achète des matelas et des chaises qu'elle met en location. Elle vend du gaz butane en bouteille. Elle fait un petit élevage de poulets de chaire et vend également des moutons. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis environ cinq ans. 

L'objet de son nouveau crédit est l'achat d'une bâche pour la confection d'une tente qu'elle va mettre en location

Son objectif est d'augmenter son niveau d'épargne et de participer financièrement à la prise en charge de la famille
texts.en:
The solidarity group BOK XALAT was created on December 4, 2007. It is composed of ten women from the same district. They have formed their group based on affinity and proximity. The group is part of the Banc Villageois of SANTHIABA SUD.

Ms. FATMA THIOUBOU D. (standing at the right in the photo and dressed in blue with a white scarf) is the group’s leader. She is 59 years old, married, and the mother of nine children. She has a small business involving various goods. She buys mattresses and chairs and rents them out. She sells butane gas in bottles. She has a few chickens she raises for meat, and she also sells sheep. She has good experience in this activity, having worked at it for about five years. 

The goal of her new loan is to buy tarp for making tents, which she is going to rent out.

Her goal is to increase her savings and to help support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy mattresses, chairs, bottled butane gas, and tarp to make tents

loans.name: Vanuvanu

texts.en:
Vanuvanu, who is 35 years of age, married, and the mother of four children, owns and operates a business that bakes and sells specialty goods and delicacies in the local community. With two years of experience in this business, she is requesting her second loan for WST $1450 to purchase additional cooking ingredients. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Vanuvanu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.

loans.use: to purchase additional cooking ingredients

loans.name: Surriya's Group

texts.en:
Surriya got married a few years ago with N. M.. She has three sons. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. She lives in a 2-room brick house in a small city called Mian Channu. Mian Channu is located in Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She is a housewife and stays at home doing her household work.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah for her husband who has an agriculture business. He grows different seasonal crops and earns good profits. Using the loan, he will purchase fertilizers, seeds and pesticides etc to get maximum results from his work. 

Surriya is hopeful that an investment will bring positive financial changes to her husband’s business and improve the living standard of her family.  

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan year, she proved herself as a responsible client by paying her installments on time and by attending every meeting.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for agriculture business.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Unidas Hacia El Progreso Group

texts.es:
Doña Elizabeth D. G., es la presidenta de Banco Mujer Unidas Hacia El Progreso, una señora muy trabajadora, de 49 años de edad, madre de 5 hijos, que por distintas situaciones no pudo seguir estudiando, dejando así sus estudios de secundaria incompletos, sin embargo eso no fue un impedimento  para desarrollar su negocio, y  con la ayuda de capacitaciones y asesorías que le bridaron algunas organizaciones pudo emprender su negocio. 

Se enteró de los servicios de Fundación Mujer por medio de una integrante de otro banco,  este es su primer crédito, y su actividad productiva es un Centro de Reciclaje, donde reciben  el material de desecho de toda la comunidad, que procesan y venden a grandes industrias. La clienta tiene su negocio hace más de 5 años, y el principal obstáculo que ha tenido que enfrentar es la falta de dinero para invertir en su  actividad, el préstamo se va a utilizar en la compra de material reciclable  para hacer crecer su negocio, generar una fuente de  empleo para su comunidad  y mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su familia. Por eso tiene sus metas y objetivos bien definidos, entre ellos están, tener un terreno propio para el negocio, porque hasta ahora tiene que alquilar unas instalaciones, además poder pagarle a sus hijos los estudios universitarios.  Estos son algunos de los sueños que se ha propuesto lograr con mucho trabajo y dedicación. 

El crédito va hacer de gran ayuda para Elizabeth y las 9 integrantes del banco, que se dedican al comercio y avicultura.
texts.en:
Elizabeth D. G. is the president of Banco Mujer Unidas Hacia El Progreso (Women United for Progress Bank). She is a hard-working 49-year-old woman who is the mother of 5 children and who, for various reasons, was not able to continue studying, leaving her secondary studies incomplete. However, this has not been an impediment to the development of her business and with the help of the capacity development trainings and advice that some organizations provided her, she was able to open her business. 

She found out about the services of Fundación Mujer from a member of another bank. This is her first loan.  Her productive activity is a recycling center where they receive all the waste material of the whole community, which they process and sell to big industry. She has had her business for over 5 years, and the principal obstacle that she faces is the lack of money to invest in her business. The loan will be used to purchase recyclable material to make her business grow, generate employment for her community and improve her quality of life and that of her family. For this she has her goals and objectives well-defined. Among them are: to have her own land for her business, because up until now she has to rent facilities, and to be able to pay for her children’s university studies. These are some of her dreams that she aims to achieve with hard work and determination.

The loan will be a big help to Elizabeth and the 9 members of the bank that work in commerce and poultry farming.

loans.use: to buy recyclable materials.

loans.name: Cherimai

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Cherimai.  She is married and has two children aged 23 and 18.  In 1999, she established her vegetable farming business.  Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.  In the future, Cherimai plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.   

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DIEU EST GRAND 2 est formé de trois personnes appartenant à la même famille. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Hermane Mireille est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Hermane Mireille ne vit plus avec son mari, mais a deux enfants, tous scolarisés qui sont à sa charge. Hermane Mireille a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire, puis a appris la coiffure, une activité qu'elle mène passionnément et qui lui permet d'assurer sans grande difficulté les diverses charges des enfants. De façon secondaire, Hermane Mireille vend des tissus et des ustensiles de cuisine (bols, glacières, etc.) par le système de distribution. Hermane Mireille s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Hermane Mireille désire obtenir un crédit avec les autres membres du groupe DIEU EST GRAND 2.
texts.en:
The group DIEU EST GRAND 2 is made up of three people who are from the same family. The representative of the group, Hermane Mireille, is the one who is raising her hand in the photo. It's the third time that this group is requesting financial aid from ALIDé in order to raise the level of their activity. 

 Hermane Mireille doesn't live with her husband but has two children, both enrolled in school, whom she is raising. She stopped going to school at the secondary level and then learned to do hairdressing, a job she is passionate about and which allows her, with great difficulty, to support her children. Secondarily, she sells cloth and kitchen utensils (bowls, ice chests, etc.) on the distribution system. 

Hermane Mireille buys her supplies in a town in Bénin. Wishing to grow her stock of products and better respond to the demand of her clientele, she wishes to receive a loan, together with the other members of the  DIEU EST GRAND 2 group.

loans.use: to buy hair products, cloth, bowls, and stackable ice chests.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 29 years old. She is married and has three children between the ages of 7 and 10 years old. Angelique has been in her salon business for two years. She employs three people in her salon. Her business is open from 7:00 AM until 7:00 PM every day.

Angelique has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more shampoo and other items for her beauty salon. With her profits, Angelique will reinvest in her business, save for her family's future, and be able to buy a house.

loans.use: to increase her business by buying more shampoo and other items for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es: Isidora, de 45 años, reside en la localidad de Palcamayo. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, es madre soltera por lo que  vive en una casa alquilada junto a sus 4 queridos hijos. Como buena mujer del campo, desde niña aprendió a cuidar y producir la tierra. Desde entonces  con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas. Ella cultiva papa, zanahoria, espinaca y arveja, las cuales luego de brindarles el cuidado necesario lleva a vender hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde las vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos. Lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde el campo a la ciudad. Además de dedicarse en la venta de carne por mayor en el mercado modelo de la ciudad de Tarma, también se dedica en la crianza de cerdos y ovejas a los que enseba para luego vender su carne cada dos a tres veces por semana.  Ahora ella se está preparando para la cosecha de espinaca y arveja, donde está segura podré obtener buenos ingresos. Por ello en adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para ampliar su producción. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen María” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Isidora de recibir su apoyo; invertirá en la compra de cerdos cuyo precio oscila entre S/. 400 soles cada uno; y si el dinero le alcanza invertirá en la compra de semilla de espinaca para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Isidora is 45 years old and lives in the town of Palcamayo.  She is known as a simple and hard-working woman.  She is a single mother and lives in a rented house with her four beloved children.  As a good country woman, she learned as a child to care for and tend the land.  Since then, with a lot of effort, she has worked her land and made it very productive.  She grows potatoes, carrots, spinach, and peas.  After she gives them the necessary care, she sells her crops in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma.  

Her crops have given her the income necessary to provide for her family, so she wants to put all of her effort into improving her business.  The thing she likes best about her work is caring for her crops.  She has been doing this work for 20 years and she thinks the most difficult part is transporting her crops from the countryside to the city.  In addition to selling meat at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma, she also raises pigs and sheep, which she fattens to later sell her meat two or three times a week.  

Now she is preparing for the spinach and pea harvest, where she is sure to earn a good profit.  In the future, she wants to purchase new land to expand her production.  

She is a member of the Virgen María community bank, and this is her ninth loan with MFP.  She hopes that a small loan will allow her to meet her goals.  She promises once again to make her payments on time, as she has done with her past loans.  She is thankful to be a part of her community bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people.  Isidora will invest her loan in the purchase of pigs, whose price is about 400 soles each, and if she has money left, she will purchase spinach seeds for her next crop.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and spinach seeds.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Uganda. She is single and has no children. She takes care of additional family members (her mother and her late brother’s children). 

Susan has a restaurant business. She has been in this business for four years and she works seven days out of every week. Susan also sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale/retail. 

Susan has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, rice, beef, sweet and Irish potatoes. The main business challenge(s) for Susan include transportation, thieves and seasonality. 

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked hotel and also to open up another restaurant in Ntinda. Susan lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees for late brother’s children and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, rice and beef

loans.name: Gantsetseg

texts.en: Gantsetseg, age 42, is a seamstress who lives with her husband and 3 children in Ulaanbaatar-the capital city of Mongolia. She makes  work wear and suits and sells them at the bazaar everyday. Gantsetseg has had her own business since 1998. Sometimes she needs to hire a sewer part-time to help  her in her business. Sometimes she has urgent orders and needs the capital to buy cloth and other supplies. So  she is taking a loan which amounts to MNT 1.000.000 to purchase some clothing  materials to increase her business production.

loans.use: To purchase some clothing materials to raise business production.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Sarah has a retail shop that sells t-shirts, blouses and underwear. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy clothes like t-shirt and blouses to sell.

Sarah is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Sarah hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes like t-shirts and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Perfecto Wellington

texts.es:
Perfecto Wellington tiene 53 años de edad, vive en unión libre junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos de 25, 22 y 14 años de edad en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo perteneciente a Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Perfecto se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz,fréjol  y comprar semillas, insumos, urea, fertilizantes, insumos agrícolas para antener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder comprar maquinaria para poder ahorrase en el alquiler de la misma para poder trabajar el terreno.

Le gusta practicar el deporte y escuchar música.
texts.en:
Perfecto Wellington is 53 years old, and lives with this common-law wife and their 3 children aged 25, 22, and 14 years old in Cantón Pueblo Viejo which is in Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

The members of V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS are located in El Marañón by Parroquia Puerto Pechiche which is in Cantón Pueblo Viejo. This service point does short-season agricultural work, growing corn, rice, and beans. 

Perfecto grows corn, rice, and beans. He buys his products from Karlita Agricultural Supply and sells them at the Castillo Market.  

He is asking for a loan to plant corn, rice, and beans and to buy seeds, supplies, urea, fertilizer, and agricultural inputs to create good growing conditions. The support of the loan will help him financially meet his needs. He faces challenges like pests, illnesses, and changing weather. His dream is to be able to buy equipment to save on rent and to use in the fields. 

He likes to play sports and listen to music.

loans.use: to plant corn, rice, beans and to buy seeds, supplies, urea, fertilizer, and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Javzmaa

texts.en: Javzmaa is 49 years old and lives with her two children in a ger, Mongolian yurt in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her two children are both college students. She started her business in 1990 by selling flour and rice at the local market. Now she owns two sales containers in which she sales the products. She is planning to expand her business in the near future. She is a diligent and hard-working woman who says, "I really want to expand my business and increase my profits." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to increase her turnover capital and purchase more flour.

loans.use: To purchase more flour

loans.name: Yaqub

texts.en: Yaqub  is 60 years old. He is married and has 2 children. Yaqub is the sole breadwinner and his only income comes from the cultivation and sale of large livestock at the local market. Every year, he buys young heifers and sheep from the farms in adjacent villages. He raises them with the help of his wife and then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers. His monthly profit is 250 USD. Yaqub would like to expand his business, as the income from his existing herd isn't enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase additional young cattle and sheep. To do this, he needs to invest an additional 1000 AZN in his business.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and fodder

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. 

Edith has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Edith has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Edith hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
la señora Maria, ya es un cliente D. la Fundación Campo, ella tiene un préstamo actualmente y es un miembro Kiva. ese préstamo lo utilizo para comprar productos para surtir su tienda como perfumenes, ropa, utiles escolares, etc. y ella esta muy contenta con los resultados obtenidos y agracese a la ayuda resivida por medio D. KIVA. actualmente ella solicita un nuevo préstamo, debido a que se avecina una temporada muy buena para la venta D. coronas y ramos, para el dia D. difuntos. El dia D. difuntos es una tradición en El Salvador y se realizan los dias 1 y 2 D. noviembre, dias en los cuales las personas asisten a los cementerios donD. tienen enterrados a sus seres queridos: mamá, papá, hermanos, tios, amigos, etc. y le llevan flores D. papel o naturales. Hay personas como Maria que se encargan D. elaborar lindas coronas con flores D. diferentes colores, tamaños y figuras, para venderlas a las personas para que se las lleven a las tumbas D. sus  seres queridos.

Maria espera trabajar bien como lo hizo con el primer credito, para obtener ingresos que le ayuden a dar a sus hijos lo necesario y para que su negocio siga fuerte y prosperando
texts.en:
Maria is already a client of Fundación Campo.  She currently has a loan and is a Kiva member.  She used her existing loan to buy products with which to stock her store such as perfumes, clothes, school supplies etc.  She is very happy with the results she is obtaining and is grateful for this repeat help through Kiva.

Maria is currently requesting a new loan because a very good season is approaching for selling wreaths and bouquets.  The Day of the Dead is a tradition in El Salvador which takes place on November 1st and 2nd.  On these days, people go to cemeteries where their loved ones are buried (mom, dad, brothers, aunts, uncles, friends, etc.) and they take with them either paper flowers or fresh flowers.  There are people such as Maria who make beautiful wreaths from flowers of different sizes, colors and shapes in order to sell them to people so that they can take them to the graves of their loved ones.

Maria hopes to work well as she did with her first loan, in order to make income which will help her to proviD. her children with what they need and help strengthen her business and enable it to do well.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making wreaths and bouquets for Day of the Dead

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE LAS MERCEDES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marleni; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos y leche y también se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como pollos y chanchos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas y también comprar alimentos para los animales.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "VIRGEN DE LAS MERCEDES", which is located in the district of Huayllabamba in the province of Urubamba, department of Cusco.

Mrs. Marleni is 40 years old and has a common-law husband and three children.  She splits her time between daily activities and running a grocery store where she sells essential goods such as rice, sugar, noodles and milk.  She also raises chickens and pigs.  The member wants to expand her grocery store and increase her livestock business.  She is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies, as well as animal feed.

The member is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies, as well as animal feed.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Arlene has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Arlene has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Arlene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 45 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. Together with her husband and children, she manages their household while operating her curtain business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Erlinda makes curtains and other products from fabric that she buys from her supplier. She offers curtains, blankets, and other home trappings. She sells her products in the community market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns approximately 300 PHP in sales every day.

Erlinda is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP to help her continue operations of her business. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials such as fabric, thread, and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands.  

Erlinda hopes her business grows and dreams of giving her children a high quality education through all her hard work. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and study the word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune marié qui pratique le commerce.Il vit dans la maison familiale avec ses frères et sœurs. Pour palier à la promiscuité, il envisage de construire trois chambres et y héberger son épouse.Il sollicite ainsi un prêt de 400000f pour compléter l'achat de matériel de construction. Son ambition est de construire sa propre maison.
texts.en:
The borrower is a newlywed who works as a merchant. He lives in the family home with his brothers and sisters. To improve intimacy, he plans to build three rooms to accommodate his wife.

Therefore he is requesting a 400,000 loan to complete his purchase of construction materials. His ambition is to build his own house.

loans.use: buy construction materials

loans.name: Hen

texts.en:
Hen, 24, is from the district of Ang Snoul. He is a hardworking and loving father of two young kids. He spends almost the whole day sitting on his tuk-tuk (motorized rickshaw), waiting for people to hire his service. His customers include both local Khmer people and foreign visitors, and he earns about $4.00 per day. In the evening, he then has to pick up his wife from a garment factory in the city, as usual. 

Hen owns a few pieces of farmland in Kompong Thom province, and he plans to grow a potato crop, which he anticipates will provide a good profit after a few months. However, he doesn’t have sufficient capital to invest in this project. Therefore, he has requested a loan to buy seed potatoes and a few sacks of fertilizer for his land. This is his second loan from HKL and Kiva, after having successfully paid off his previous loan.

loans.use: to buy seed potatoes and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stocks of sugar, flour, rice, and cooking oil

loans.name: Luz Mary

texts.es: La señora Luz Mary a sus 51 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa femenina, su negocio surgió desde hace cuatro años de la necesidad de generar su propios ingresos luego de quedarse sin empleo y sin el apoyo de su cónyuge del cual se separó hace varios años, quedando sola con la obligación de su hogar y dos hijos. Actualmente, la señora Luz Mary necesita de la compra de jeans, camisetas y ropa interior femenina con lo cual pueda generar el inventario necesario para suplir la demanda de sus clientes, mejorar sus ventas y así la calidad de vida de su familia. A futuro, la señora Luz Mary sueña con tener su propio almacén de venta de ropa y ver a sus dos hijos como profesionales.
texts.en:
Ms. Luz Mary at her 51 years of age sells women's clothing. Her business started up four years ago out of the need to generate her own income after becoming unemployed and without her spouse's support, from whom she separated a number of years ago, ending up alone with the responsibility of her home and two children. 

Currently Ms. Luz Mary needs to purchase jeans, T shirts and women's underwear with which she may generate the necessary inventory to supply the demands of her customers, improve sales and thus her family's quality of life. 

In the future Ms. Luz Mary dreams of having her own clothing store and of seeing her two children become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothing items.

loans.name: Juntos Para El Exito Group

texts.es: Un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras, trabajadoras y unidas, así está conformada  el grupo  "Juntos para el Exito" , integrada por 7 personas,  sobresalen grandes mujeres, cada una con una historia en particular una de ellas es la señora Mónica de 25 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 3 hijos pequeños,  desde pequeña vivió rodeada de ejemplos y coraje que la animaron a emprender el negocio de Venta de ropa  ya con 5 años en el negocio a podido dar lo mejor a sus 3  hijos como educacion y alimentacion, ya que comenzó a vender a la gente de su barrio y ahora tiene clientes fijos, en los tiempos libres también lava ropa, con grandes sueños y metas por cumplir, en el fututo piensa poner un local para la venta de ropa y con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en comprar  más mercadería y poder tener lo necesario para salir adelante por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
A group of enterprising, hardworking and united women formed the “Juntos para el Exito” group.  It has seven outstanding women as members, each with her own particular story.

One of them is Mónica, 25.  She has a spouse and three little children.  Since childhood she lived surrounded by examples of courage that motivated her to start a business selling clothes and now, with five years’ experience in the business, she’s been able to give the best to her three children like education and food.  

She started out selling to locals in her neighborhood and now she has regular customers.  In her free time she also takes in laundry.  

She has great dreams and goals to reach.  In the future, she plans to open a clothing store and will use the latest loan to buy more merchandise so that she can have everything necessary to get ahead for her family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix es un joven de 19 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Felix no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Derecho que deseaba, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina come una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca, el cual es su plato favorito.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Felix trabaja en una empresa de transporte de su ciudad, en el área de almacén, él trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, Felix se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Felix se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea poder hacer el tarrajeo, pintado y puesta de piso de concreto en su habitación, de esta manera él podrá contar un ambiente adecuado y seguro, que le brinde mayor bienestar; así pues Felix desea poder seguir trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder estudiar una carrera y convertirse en un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Felix is a young man of 19 years old. He is single and lives in the city of Nazca with his parents and siblings. He is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who really wants to improve himself. Due to the lack of money and the need to work, Felix was not able to study for the professional career in Law that he wanted, but he would very much like to be able to do it. In his spare time he enjoys watching television and sometimes cooks things like a delicious "Carapulcra con Sopa Seca" (Pork stew with a noodle casserole), which is his favourite meal.

On his own initiative and with a lot of effort and dedication, Felix works in the warehouse of a transportation company in his city. He works every day from early in the morning and works for about 8 hours. Felix feels at ease working and believes that it is going well thanks to his diligence and the friendly attitude he has towards others.

Felix is very grateful to all of the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help offered he will be able to carry out improvements to his house. He wants to be able to plaster and paint his room, and also to install a concrete floor. This way he will be able to have a suitable and safe environment, which will help his well-being. Felix also wants to carry on working and striving to be able to realise his dream of studying for a career and becoming a good professional.

loans.use: to make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a dairy farming business.

loans.name: Laukiana

texts.en:
Laukiana,46,is a widow with eight children and grandchildren.  Her  husband died a few years ago.  She wants to expand her bakery business to support her eight children and grandchildren's school fees.  Prior to joining the SPBDF program, she was unemployed and relied upon money sent from relatives living in New Zealand.

Laukiana received her first loan from the SPBDF in 2003 when she started her bakery business. She sells her products to pre-schools and primary schools in her village and nearby villages and earns 200 tala per week.

She now wishes to borrow an additional $1,200 in order to purchase supplies and equipment that will allow her to sell to more schools in nearby villages.

loans.use: To purchase additional flour, sugar, shortening and baking equipment to expand her business.

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Linh is 37 and her husband Xuan is 35. They have two children who are 7 and 11 and go to school. They don’t own any land so Linh's husband works as a daily laborer but he can’t find work easily.

Recently the family rented 6000 square meters of land to grow cassava, but the crop hasn't grown yet, so they don't have income from it yet.

Linh sells rice cakes door to door and raises pigs at their house to earn money. Their income averages about $13 per person per month.

Linh wants to borrow $100 to sell her rice cakes and raise pigs and to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: Linh would like to increase her business raising pigs, selling rice cakes and to buy fertilizer for her cassava plants.

loans.name: Akouv

texts.fr:
At the age of 31, Akouvi A. is married and the mother of two. She is a hairdresser and has opened her salon with her meager funds. Her salon is not well-equipped, leading to lost customers and making her business unprofitable.

Very determined to realize her dreams, Ms. A. is asking for $500 of financial support to acquire a new hair dryer and beauty supplies. This will build up her level of business and make it most worthwhile.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

A 31 ans, Madame A. Akouvi est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Elle est coiffeuse et a ouvert son salon de coiffure avec ses maigres moyens. Son salon n’est pas bien équipé ce qui fait qu’elle perd les clientes et n’arrive pas à rentabiliser son activité.

Très déterminée à réaliser ses rêves, Madame A. Akouvi sollicite un appui financier de $500 pour s’acheter un nouvel séchoir et des produits cosmétiques afin de rehausser le niveau de son activité et en profiter au maximum.

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer and beauty supplies

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en: Mrs T. is a fifty-three-year-old woman with seven children. She has been very interested in making and cooking barbeque foods since she was a teenager, and that’s why she took it as her business and used her $300 loan to buy the ingredients. She believes that even though it is a very hard business, she is strong enough to make it and she thinks she will get more profits from it. She is looking forward to another loan to buy a gas oven which is much easier and saves time because she will not have to collect firewood or provide charcoal as with her current charcoal oven. She will be very happy to stay for a long time in the loan programme

loans.use: Buying meats for the Barbeque

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Business Description

Maria C. has a dressmaking studio where she sews all types of clothing and also a shop where she sells sewing supplies

Loan Use

She needs the loan in order to purchase more fabric for clothing and supplies for her shop. She would also like to purchase a better sewing machine to improve the quality of the clothing she makes.

Personal Information

She is 44 years old and has 4 children, 2 of whom are in school. Her husband is a carpenter and together they live in a cement house. They live in a stable community and get along well with their neighbors.

loans.use: Purchase more fabric for clothing and supplies for her shop

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Mrs. Dora A. is 48 years old, a widow with five children, and she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells jewelry and accessories in an open market. This is a business she learned for 6 months before she opened hers. She is soliciting a loan of $275 to enable her to buy more jewelry to sell.

loans.use: Dora would like to buy more jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en: Adama S. is 35 years old and married with five children. She runs a small local restaurant in Kabala town of Sierra Leone. Adama is very grateful to SMT because she can now generate enough income to meet her family's daily needs and expenses. To expand and diversify her business, Adama plans to acquire a refrigerator to chill the drinks she sells and enable her to make additional sales. She is therefore requesting a $350 loan to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.use: She would like to buy a refrigerator to further expand her business and attract new customers.

loans.name: Namugongo(I) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Christine L.. She is currently in the business of selling chicken feed and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to expand her business. Christine is 27 years old and married to a trader. She has 2 children ranging from age 4 to 6 and her children go to school. Each week, Christine makes approximately UGX 200,000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build rental houses. Christine has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300,000 in order to invest in a retail shop business and the loan was paid back on time.

Christine is joined in her small group by Betty N., Saida K., Annet N., and Jane Nakimera. Betty N. runs a canteen and is requesting a loan of UGX 400,000 to increase the canteen stock. Saida K. sells irish potatoes and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to start sellling a greater variety of foodstuffs. Annet N. operates a public pay phone and is requesting a loan of UGX 400,000 to purchase more airtime cards. Jane Nakimera sells matooke (plantain) and is requesting a loan of UGX 50,000 to increase stock.

loans.use: To expand her chicken feed business

loans.name: Nassuti A(Ii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Annet N.. She is currently in the business of poultry keeping and is requesting a loan to purchase poultry feed. Annet is 30 years old and is married. She has 3 children ranging from age 8 to 12 and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy new poultry breeds and pay the school fees for her children.

Annet is joined in her small group by Mastula N., Nalongo S., Juliet K., and Amandah M.. Mastula N. has a business making and selling snacks and wants to expand her business. Nalongo S. is currently operating a fresh foods business and wants a loan to increase stock. Juliet K. operates a business of selling vegetables and wants to add capital. Amandah M. is currently in the business of running a bar and is requesting a loan to purchase a fridge.

loans.use: To add working capital to poultry business

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Francisca M. J. is a 49 year old woman who attended school through the third grade. She has six children, but only one is one child still at home. She lives in the Otuzco province in the La Libertad department of Peru. Maria sells items in the Otuzco market. Her business offers fruit, vegetables, and wool items. For the past 15 years she has been selling in this market, and up to the present it has worked out very well for her. She began selling only wool items and thread. Little by little her business has grown, and she has offered additional items for sale. Maria joined the “Mujeres del Olivo” community bank, where she obtained her first loan of 300 soles ($100) which she used to purchase various items to sell. With this 500 sol loan, ($200) which she will repay in four months, she will purchase 15 bats of wool, 10 boxes of fruit, and a variety of vegetables. Her greatest dream is to keep working and saving to purchase her own home, as she now lives in a place which she rents.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria Francisca Monzón Jiménez tiene 49 años de edad, estudio solo hasta el tercer grado de primaria. Tiene en total seis hijos pero solo uno depende de ella. Vive en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad – Perú. Ella vende en condición de ambulante en el mercado de Otuzco. Su negocio es la venta de frutas, verduras y lanas. Hace 15 años que vende en este lugar y hasta la actualidad le ha ido muy bien, primero se inicio vendiendo lanas e hilos. Poco a poco ha ido incrementando su negocio, ha variado con otras mercería. Ella integra el Banco Comunal “Mujeres del Olivo” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro varios productos para surtir su puesto. Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00 el cual cancelara en cuatro meses comprara 15 moños de lana, 10 cajas de frutas y variedad de verduras . Su mayor sueño es seguir trabajando para construir su casa ya que donde vive es alquilado

loans.use: This loan will be used to purchase fruit, vegetables and wool for sale.

loans.name: Restaurador Group

texts.en:
The Committee of Entrepreneuring women is a program carried out by Fundación Paraguaya which targets groups of enterprising women who create a village bank through which they receive assistance in terms of loans. The main goal is to give them the opportunity to carry out economic activities which enable them to live in dignity and contribute to a better quality of life in their homes. Lending to poor women creates a cascading effect that brings social and economic benefits to a whole family, and thus to the entire community. What is more, the sense of belonging to a group gives these poor women, as member of a Committee, the energy and motivation to reach success.

Eight women who belonged previously to a Committee of Entrepreneuring women decided to form a new one with their new friends and neighbors. They set up a meeting and invited many women from the town. There they shared with these women their previous experience in the Committee and explained to them how the Committee changed their lives. Their hopeful words stimulated optimism among these women and they decided to form a Committee.

The Committee is formed by 18 women whose entrepreneurial activities include: sewing shops, stationeries, grocery stores, sales of drinks, vegetables, jewelry, clothes, lingerie.

The credit provided will be used for the purchase of: fabrics, thread, cloth, lingerie, drinks, vegetables, books, papers, pens, pencils and others.

loans.use: purchase of: fabrics, thread, cloth, lingerie, drinks, vegetables, books, papers, pens, pencils, sugar, meat, oil, flour and others

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Thanks to Dina’s cows, which she tends every morning and they love her attention, they give Dina a great amount of milk. She sells the milk and also prepares delicious cheese. Thanks to the cows and Dina’s grand effort she is able to have the necessary income for her household needs. She would like to purchase another cow to be able to increase the making of cheese and also to satisfy her clients needs.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

DINA gracias a sus vaquitas a quienes atiende desde muy temprano, debido a que complacidas por la buena atención que les otorga día a día le otorgan una gran cantidad de leche para que pueda comercializarla y también para preparar deliciosos quesos. Gracias a ellas y al esfuerzo de Dina las cosas dentro de su hogar marchan muy bien y tiene el deseo de comprar una vaquita más para incrementar su producción de quesos y así satisfacer las peticiones de sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase a little cow.

loans.name: Faizullo

texts.en:
Faizullo I. is 53 years old. He is married with three children.

Together with his wife, Faizullo sells fabrics to make the national dresses. Their store is located in the central local market. Faizullo has been in this business for 10 years. In order to have a wide range of goods for any taste and any wallet, Faizullo travels to the neighboring town of Istaravshan almost every month to purchase new goods. During his business absence, Faizullo’s wife helps him in the market, making sales.

Faizullo has managed to increase his clientele, but he is not able to fully meet their demand. Therefore, he needs a loan of 3000 Somoni ($875 USD) for the term of 4 months. With the loan, he wants to increase his stock to earn more income. With the income, he will provide his children with a good education and help to meet all of their needs. Additionay, in the near future, he is planning to arrange the marriage of his son.

Your generosity can change their lives. Help them by contributing to the growth of his business, and they will sincerely thank you.

loans.use: To Purchase the new fabrics to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Vilma Elizabeth

texts.es:
Vilma is 49 years of age. She has six children, whom she had to raise on her own. She currently lives with one of her daughters. In the past, Vilma worked in different jobs. Her courage and integrity allowed her to work selling different items for over 20 years. In order to do so, she worked as a housekeeper for a while, which permitted her to raise capital. She started selling knit apparel with an Italian family, and she continues in this business until now.

She currently sells shampoo, which she offers to her friends and neighbors, and she also knits when customers request it. Her daughter has a restaurant, and she takes advantage of this so that she can offer her products to the patrons using her distinctive charisma. She thinks that the most difficult part of her job is obtaining products at an affordable price in order to boost profits. However, this business pleases her very much, and this motivates her to continue.

Vilma is requesting this loan in order to invest it in the purchase of wholesale merchandise, thus permitting her to yield greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Vilma tiene 49 años, tuvo 6 hijos a los cuales tuvo que mantener ella sola, actualmente vive con una D. sus hijas. En el pasado Vilma trabajó D. diversas formas, su valentía y entereza hicieron que durante más D. 20 años se desempeñara en la ventas D. diferentes artículos, para ello, trabajó un tiempo como empleada domestica, donD. reunió el capital. Fue con una familia italiana que se inició vendiendo prendas tejidas y continúa hasta hoy.

En la actualidad, se dedica a la venta D. champú, que ofrece a sus vecinos y amistades, y teje cuando le pidan ese servicio. Su hija tiene un restaurante y ella aprovecha esto, para que con el carisma que le caracteriza, ofrezca sus productos a los comensales.Considera que lo más difícil D. su trabajo es conseguir productos baratos para que pueda obtener ganancias. Esta actividad le agrada mucho y esto le anima a continuar.

Vilma solicita el presente préstamo para invertir en la compra D. mercadería al por mayor para así obtener mejores ganancias.

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata is 59 years old and lives with her 59 year-old husband Hernando, who is a driver, and also with her daughter Mariela, who is 20 years old and studies at the college level in the city of Juliaca. For the past three years, Fortunata has run a grocery store that she opened in her home. She has put a lot of affection and effort into the business in order to make it bear fruit and generate good income. Fortunata’s family has always supported her, and when her husband is not working he stays and helps her with the store, as does her daughter when she returns from her studies in the city. Fortunata likes her business since she has put so much effort into it.

Fortunata hopes that her daughter will get ahead and be a successful professional, so that she can work and survive in the city and not have to stay in the country like Fortunata. With the money from her loan, Fortunata will purchase supplies in order to grow her small store.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Fortunata tiene 59 años, vive con su esposo Hernando D. 59 años, el cual es chofer y con su hija Mariela D. 20, quien cursa sus estudios superiores en la ciudad D. Juliaca. Hace tres años atrás, se dedica a atender su tienda D. comestibles que abrió en su casa, en ella, ha puesto mucho cariño y empeño para hacer que D. frutos y pueda ser generadora D. ingresos. Su familia siempre la ha apoyado y cuando su esposo no está trabajando pueD. quedarse a ayudarla en la tienda, al igual que su hija, cuando llega D. estudiar D. la ciudad, le ayuda. A Fortunata le gusta su negocio ya que le ha puesto mucho esfuerzo en ella. Su deseo es que su hija la supere, que sea una profesional D. éxito, para que pueda trabajar y superarse en la ciudad y no se queD. solamente en el campo, como ella. Con el dinero del préstamo comprara mercadería para hacer crecer su pequeña tienda.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell in her small grocery store

loans.name: Svjetlana

texts.en:
Svjetlana B., born in 1989, comes from Doboj where she works in a coffee shop, earning over $350 monthly. She enjoys the work because it places her in constant contact with people who are potential clients for her home-based computer business, which revolves around designing and printing diplomas, marketing materials, price lists, etc.  

Because she needs a new printer and some other equipment to improve her business, Svjetlana is requesting a loan in the amount of $450.  This loan will allow her to expand her business and acquire more clients.

loans.use: To buy computer-related equipment.

loans.name: María Estela

texts.es:
En el mercado central de Chinandega, la señora María N. se dedica desde hace 3 años con muchísimo esfuerzo al negocio de venta de ropa el cual es comercializada con mucha dedicación en su propio tramo ubicado en el sector de ropa.

Es una dama con la obligación de mantener a sus tres pequeños hijos que son el motive de sus grandes esfuerzos. Una de las necesidades que hoy en dia ella atraviesa es que requiere adquirir ropa para comercializarla y es por esta razón que ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le de la oportunidad de adquirir la mercadería y continuar en su negocio de venta de ropa.
texts.en:
In the central market of Chinandega, Maria N. has sold clothing for the past three years with much effort and dedication in her own plot in the garment sector. She is a lady with the responsibility of raising their three small children who are the motive for her great efforts. Today, one of her needs is to purchase clothing for marketing; it is for this reason she has gone to Ceprodel to request credit for the opportunity to purchase the goods and continue her business of selling goods.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
E. Mary is married and has 2 children. She has received a junior high education. Her husband is a teacher.

Mary sells groceries like biscuits, sugar, Milo, and milk at Elmina, a business she started not long ago. She is responsible for assisting her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more groceries for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into her shop.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for resale.

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate is 37years old and is married with 2 children. She sells newspapers to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. 

Kate is a LAPO client. She needs the loan of N100,000 to purchase more newspaper to sell. She says "thank you" to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase newspapers to sell

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Самадова Назира проживает в районе Вахш. Ей 40 лет и уже 5 лет она занимается торговлей. Имеет торговую точку на рынке , которая нуждается в ремонте. Она планирует создать условия необходимые для работы. Для закупки материала и оплаты услуг она решила получить кредит сроком на 9 месяцев. Назира замужем и имеет троих детей.Муж на заработках в России , поэтому она одна обеспечивает семью.
texts.en:
Nazira S. resides in the Bakhsh region. She is 40 years old and for the past five years has been in trade. She has a retail outlet in the marketplace that is in need of upgrades. She plans to make improvements to her workplace, and has decided to take out a 9-month loan to pay for materials and labor. Nazira is married and has three children, but her husband is away working in Russia, so she is the sole support of her family.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of shelving in her workplace

loans.name: Nila Violeta

texts.es:
La señora Nila Violeta Z. C. tiene 49 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Jesús Nazareno  del distrito de Agallpampa en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Cursó hasta el cuarto grado de educación primaria y por falta de apoyo familiar no continuó estudiando. 
Se casó de 22 años y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales dependen de ella solamente 2.
Nila tiene una bodega donde vende artículos de primera necesidad y carne de pollo que adquiere en los mercados de Trujillo.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas, lo invirtió en compra de artículos para volver a vender.
