Con este crédito de 1500 que será cancelado en 6 cuotas invertirá en viveres y en pollo.
Nila sueña con tener un negocio muy grande.
texts.en:
Nila Violeta Z. C. is 49 years old and belongs to the Jesús Nazareno Communal Bank of the Agallpampa district in the Otuzco province in the department of La Libertad, Perú. She attended school until the fourth grade and because of the lack of family support she did not continue studying. She got married about 22 years of age and has 4 children of which only 2 are dependent upon her. Nila has a small store where she sells essential household items and chicken meat that she acquires at the Trujillo markets. With her first loan of 300 soles, which was paid back in 4 installments, she invested it in the purchase of articles to resell. With this loan of 1500 that will be repaid in 6 installments she will invest in groceries and in chicken. Nila dreams of having a very big business.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries and chicken for her store.

loans.name: Talalatou

texts.fr: Cette dame a pour activité la vente de charbons de bois et des ustensiles de cuisine, elle fait ce commerce depuis 1999, elle habite le quartier d’agoè logopé, actuellement son stock de marchandises est épuisé et elle sollicite un prêt de wages pour s’acheter 18 sacs de charbons de bois ,08 séries d’assiette et 08 séries de casseroles pour se réapprovisionner. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants.
texts.en:
This is a lady who sells charcoal and kitchen utensils. She has been in this business since 1999. She lives in the Agoè Logopé district. Currently, her stock of merchandise is exhausted, and she’s requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 18 sacks of charcoal, 8 sets of plates, and 8 sets of sauce pans in order to resupply herself. She is married and the mother of two.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha C., 56,  is a housewife with nine children. She lives in Lopez Jaena Mis Occ. Her husband is an amakan (bamboo mat) maker. She also sells amakan for a living. The loan is for additional capital for their amakan business, which they sell to other towns. She hopes buy a vehicle for their business and build a house for her family someday.

loans.use: Additional capital for amakan (bamboo mat) business

loans.name: Sabaly (La Patience) Group

texts.fr:
Sabaly est un regroupement de  femmes de  Kimparana (région de Ségou) qui se connaissent bien à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans, mariées et mères d’au moins 3  enfants.
 Elles mènent différentes activités qui sont entre autres la   restauration, la vente de condiments, et  de fruits.
 Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis deux années. Le montant du prêt est passé de 50.000 FCFA au premier prêt à 125.000 FCFA pour le troisième  prêt solidaire. Tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter  des sacs de riz à San et des condiments alimentaires de toutes sortes pour la restauration. Quant aux fruits  ils sont achetés au fur et à mesure qu’elles sont vendus car ne pouvant être stocké longtemps. Elles vendent leurs marchandises dans des gargotes,  au marché et devant la porte de leur maison
 Ainsi avec ce prêt, elles comptent réaliser en moyenne 140 000 FCFA. de bénéfice au cours du cycle.
 En plus du remboursement du prêt elles utiliseront une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. .
texts.en:
Sabaly is a group of women of Kimparana (Ségou region) who know one another well through ties of kinship and community. Averaging 33 years of age, they are married and the mothers of at least three children. The women do different work, including food catering and selling condiments and fruit.

To expand their businesses, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program two years ago. Loan amounts have gone from 50,000 francs CFA for the first loan to 125,000 francs for the third solidarity loan (group loan). All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid.

The current loan will be used to buy sacks of rice in San and some condiments of all kinds for preparing and selling food. As for the fruit, it's purchased as it's sold because it cannot be stored for long. Sales are made in eateries, at the marketplace, and outside their front doors.

Thus, with this loan, the group members plan to realize an average profit of 140,000 francs in the course of the cycle. In addition to making loan payments, they will use a portion of the revenues for coping with common family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and condiments for catering and to buy fruit

loans.name: Khairullo

texts.en:
“Responsible fatherhood” is a term that has been converted into a concrete fact in Khairullo’s life. He has always responded satisfactorily to his role as provider for his three children, for whom he cares with much love, in the company of his wife, who is always supportive of him. 

Khairullo works in agricultural activities and has some cattle. He cultivates wheat and onion and other vegetables subject to season. At the moment, he is working intensively at his agricultural activities and taking care of his fields. His wife is helping take care of the cows and also sells their milk. They do all this hard work because they want to give an education to each of their three children. They would also like to open a small business some day; until then they will continue working in their fields. To do this, Khairullo is requesting a loan of $ 650 USD to buy the seeds and mineral fertilizers. Let’s support Khairullo in his continuous efforts to provide for the wellbeing of his family. 
  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell shoes and handbags

loans.name: Christine Anyango

texts.en:
Christine Anyango O. is a 31-year-old widow who takes care of two children aged 16 ad 14. They are both in school. She sells second-hand clothes, purchased at Kibuye market (Kisumu’s largest open-air market) and sells them by going door to door in Nyamasaria. Her challenges are that there are so many other people also selling used clothes. and the wholesalers have raised the price of bales. Christine has thought about starting a new business to sell vegetables from Nakuru in Kibuye. Her hopes for the future are to have a big business, to send her children to university and to own her own home. In her free-time she likes to watch videos and take her children on little tours.

In this video, you can hear me greet Christine saying "Idhi Nade", which is Luo for "How are you?" Christine responds, "Adhi maber," meaning "very good." Most people living in Kisumu descend from the Luo tribe, the same tribe as Obama's father. At the end, you will hear me fluctuate between Kiswahili and Luo saying "Asante Sana" in Kiswahili, meaning "thank you" and "Erokamano", which in Luo, means "thank you." The voices you hear in the background are people coming for a weekly K-MET borrower meeting. To see what one looks like, check out the first video in this blog post.

K-MET, the NGO distributing the loan, is unique in that it is not a traditional MFI. Rather, it is a development corporation focused on raising health standards in Kenya. You can read more about K-MET’s work.

loans.use: To buy clothing stock and vegetables

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha tiene 34 años, vive con sus hijos; Jerson de 16 y David de 14,  ya que su esposo se fue a trabajar al país de Chile, desde donde le manda dinero para los gastos de su hogar. Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza, incursionó en este negocio para generarse ganancias adicionales a lo que le manda su esposo. Por eso vendes esta bebida en la loza deportiva cerca su casa, donde todos los días sábados se reúne gran cantidad de gente para jugar campeonatos deportivos de fútbol. Además, también lo hace de lunes a viernes en su casa, guardando las bebidas en su refrigeradora para mantenerlas a tiempo para así venderlas a sus vecinos, quienes son sus principales clientes, siendo esta una gran fuente de ingresos porque es la única persona que vende esta bebida por su zona. Pero no todo es bueno, ya que algunas veces tiene que lidiar con personas que no quieren pagarle, ocasionándole pérdidas en el negocio, es por eso que la experiencia le ha enseñado a asegurarse cobrando primero. Ahora su negocio obtiene menos pérdidas y mayor cantidad de ingresos, dándole a Martha las esperanzas de seguir creciendo hasta conseguir una tienda donde también venda productos comestibles. Este es si 5to préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, siempre demostró responsabilidad y puntualidad en todos sus pagos al igual que todas sus compañeras. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más productos de la distribuidora de cerveza más cercana a su casa.
texts.en:
Martha is 34 years old and lives with her two sons, Jerson, sixteen, and David, fourteen. Her husband is working in Chile. He sends her money from Chile for her household expenses. Martha sells beer. She became involved in this business in order to earn additional money to augment what her husband sends to her. She sells her beer at the sports field near her house. Every Saturday a large group of people gather there to compete in soccer. Also, from Monday to Friday, she sells beer from her house to her neighbors who are her principal customers. She keeps the beer cold in her refrigerator. This is a great source of income because she is the only person who sells this drink in her area. Everything is not great though. Sometimes she has to deal with people who don’t want to pay her which causes her business loses. These experiences have taught her that she needs to get paid before providing her product. Now her business has less loses and more income. Martha hopes that her business will continue to grow. She would like to have a store where she can also sell other types of goods. This is Martha’s fifth loan with PRISMA microfinance. She has always responsibly and punctually paid back her loans, as have her companions. With the money she is requesting, she will buy more products from the beer distributor close to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Abida Parveen Altaf Hussain Group

texts.en:
Abida parveen baji is a wife of A. H. and has lived in a city named Lahore, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Lahore is famous for its historical places and for Punjabi foods. Her husband runs a business selling medicines. He buys medicines wholesale and sells them to medical stores to earn income. He has been in this business for the past five years. Abida baji is applying for a loan to advance his business.

This loan is consists of four additional people:

Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy a lathe machine. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to sell. Mairaj baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Saeeda baji wants a loan to buy paint boxes to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Abida baji is seated on the front left side in this photo.

loans.use: To buy medicines to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia D. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 54, married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Delia owns & operates a general store; she sells a variety of different products to the local community. Delia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Delia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia  repaid a previous loan of 14,500 PHP from PMPC, which she used to purchase additional products to sell. Delia is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP for the same purpose. This loan will be her 6th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ulises Antonio

texts.es: El señor Ulises Pérez tiene 43 años de edad, casado, reside en el municipio Villa del Carmen del departamento de Managua, su esposa ama de casa tiene dos hijos de 17 y 13 años de edad,  tiene como  planes en mejorar su forma de vida, trabaja en la Alcaldía Villa del Carmen como técnico de educación desde hace ocho meses, posee un pequeño negocio de variedades en donde vende los productos como: gaseosa, arroz, frijoles y otros. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic lograra comprar: aceites, azúcar, cosméticos, y productos de uso diario. Generándole mayores utilidades y ofreciéndole a su familia mayores comodidades. Da las gracias  a la institución por el préstamo ya que se benefiaciara en poder invertir mas lo cual obtendrá mejores ganancia
texts.en:
Sr. Ulises Pérez is 43 years old, married, and lives in the town of Villa del Carmen in the district of Managua. His wife is a homemaker. They have two children, ages 17 and 13. He hopes to make life better for his family. Sr. Ulises has been working for 8 months for the town of Villa del Carmen as an education trainer.

He has a small variety store where he sells products such as soft drinks, rice, beans, and other items. Thanks to his loan from AFODENIC he will be able to buy oil, sugar, cosmetics, and other everyday household products. He hopes to generate better profits and offer his family more comfortable living conditions. He thanks the Institution for this loan and the benefit it will give him through higher earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase consumer products

loans.name: Cherry Rose

texts.en:
Cherry Rose R. is from the village of Poblacion 2 Clarin,Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Cherry Rose is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Cherry Rose owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Cherry Rose has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cherry Rose joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cherry Rose is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Cherry Rose from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela T. is from the village of Banawan, Iligan City. She is 50 years old, married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Adela owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling bananas in the local community. Adela has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Adela joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adela is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Batbaatar

texts.en:
Batbaatar is 40 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Arkhangai Province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a yurt or traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Batbaatar’s three youngest children attend high school. His oldest son helps him to operate a local car repair business.  

Batbaatar started his business in 2000 with working capital of 100,000 tugrug (~$70 USD). His business as grown substantially and he now more than 1,300,000 tugrug (~$914 USD) in working capital. Batbaatar has been working on cars since he was a child and, because of his many years of experience, he is known in his town for quality repairs. He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~$1400 USD) loan to purchase more car repair supplies and tools.

loans.use: To purchase car repair supplies and tools.

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.en: Martha Isabel M. S. is 53 years old Both of her children are grown and have married. She meets the demands of the lunch crowd at a large central market in Nicaragua. She inherited her business from her mother about four years ago, but grew up learning from her mom and assisting in the family business. Martha dreams of having a space dedicated entirely to her business where she would be able to expand the products she offers and be able to earn more for her family. This isn’t her first loan with Fundacion Leon 2000. She has a good credit history and a strong relationship with the organization.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Silas Anangwe

texts.en:
Silas is a 23-year-old married father blessed with two children.  His retail shop is located in the town of Panpaper.  He wants to improve his business prospects and decided to seek out a loan, so he visited a KADET branch and applied for a loan. This is his first loan with KADET and he plans to use it to add more stock of cooking oil, sugar, and rice to his shop.  Silas plans to become a distributor to other retail shops and one day dreams of becoming a landlord.  He views rental homes as a more stable income.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to the economic empowerment of their clients across Kenya by providing financial services to improve living conditions for the micro-entrepreneurs and their children. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. You can obtain more information on KADET from their website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To add more stock to his retail shop, such as cooking oil, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie T. is from the city of LABUYO, TANGUB CITY. She is 41 years old. Tessie is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Tessie owns and operates a business providing motorcycle services to local community members. Tessie has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $125 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Tessie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Tessie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en: Dominic is 33 years old and married with three children, aged one through ten. He has a small retail business and also earns some income through small-scale farming. He has successfully completed three loans through Faulu and is now requesting a loan for Kes. 35,000 to add more stock. In the future, he hopes to grow his business and own a hardware store.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
Para reconstruir una vivienda se necesita mucha dedicación y mucho dinero por lo que se debe comprar los materiales de construcción. Sin embargo, la señora Flor R. le interesa muchísimo el bienestar de su familia y ella ha decidido invertir en la compra de dichos materiales de construcción porque reconstruirá su vivienda que ha estado en malas condiciones y así brindará mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Es por esta razón que solicita en Ceprodel un crédito oportuno para dar lugar a esta obra y así continuar en el desarrollo familiar. 

Ella se desempeña como maestra en un colegio de una comarca en Managua y busca la manera de continuar desarrollándose cada día hasta alcanzar su meta de construcción.
texts.en:
To reconstruct a house you need a lot of dedication and money, because you must buy the construction materials. Nevertheless, Señora Flor R. is very interested in the wellbeing of her family and she has decided to invest in the purchase of said construction materials, because she will reconstruct her home, which is in poor condition, and in this way provide better living conditions for her family. It is for this reason that she is seeking in Ceprodel a timely loan to allow this work, and in this way continue the development of her family. She holds a role as a college teacher in a region in Managua and looks for the way to continue developing each day until she reaches her construction goal.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Claudia Lissette

texts.es: Claudia tiene 29 años, La actividad económica de ella es la venta de cosméticos. No es la primera vez que realiza un financiamiento por lo que fue una muy buena experiencia.  Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella decidió escoger este tipo de trabajo por ser uno de las fuentes de ingresos más accesibles además le gusta mucho este tipo de trabajo.  Ya que además continua trabajando como agente de ventas y con ambos trabajos trata de mejorar sus ingresos y los de su familia. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para capital de trabajo destinado para materia prima. El deseo de Claudia es vender todos sus productos y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Claudia is 29 years old. She sells cosmetics for a living. She's been in this business for more than 11 years and decided on this particular business because it's one of the easiest accessible sources of income and besides, she loves this kind of work. Claudia also continues to work as a sales agent in order to improve her income and that of her family. This isn't the first time she is requesting a loan, since it was such a great experience last time. The loan she is requesting will be used as working capital to purchase raw materials for her business. Her desire is to sell all her products and improve her housing.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo. (to use as working capital for her business)

loans.name: Aytakin

texts.en: Aytakin was born in 1985. She is married and has one child. This young woman is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, and is now settled in Khirdalan town. She has been in this business for nine years. She needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to expand the area.

loans.use: to expand the area

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. O. is thirty-five years old. She is married to a peasant farmer and they have two children. Her children are still young and she and her husband hope that they will be able to give the children a quality education.

Grace’s business is situated by the roadside at Manyatta Estate in Kisumu. Before opening a stall, she used to hawk her goods (go door-to-door) to the people of Kisumu. She has been doing this business for the last four years and she is very determined to continue growing her business until she opens a boutique.

Grace says that her major challenge is sustaining customers as there are many people doing the same kind of business as hers.

Grace is using her loan to buy more clothes to expand her business. She is a very hardworking and responsible lady.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: God's Blessing Group

texts.en:
Eyeah G. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called God’s Blessing. She is 57 years old, married, and has 5 children aged 18-30 years old. Their educational levels are 11th grade to college senior. Eyeah was not able to attend school when she was a youth due to poverty. 

Eyeah's business is sale of food items such as oil, rice, peanuts and beans. She buys her goods wholesale and sells retail on a table to residents of her community in Paynesville. She has been running her business for 20 years and hopes to own a shop in the near future.

Eyeah talks to her customers in a friendly manner in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. Eyeah needs this loan to purchase additional oil, rice, peanuts and beans. Her dream is to continue giving her children an education.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Eyeah is the one holding the sign.  Henry T. is inset at lower right.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase additional oil, rice, peanuts and beans.

loans.name: Type Of Business Group

texts.en:
Nancy V. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Type of Business.  She is married and has six children who range in age from 6 to 25 years old.  Nancy was never able to attend school due to poverty.
For 25 years, Nancy has been selling dried fish and vegetables at the Smell No Taste Market in Harbel. She says that she provides her customers with high quality food, which keeps them coming to her for business.
Nancy plans to use her 5,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 25,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more dried fish and vegetables.  Her dream is for all of her children to be responsible.
In the photo that accompanies this profile, Nancy is the one holding the sign.
About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase additional dried fish and vegetables.

loans.name: Sefinat

texts.en:
Sefinat owns a shop where she sells drinks and groceries at retail prices. She wants to expand and improve on her business so as to increase her profits and save for the future.
Sefinat is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more drinks to sell to meet customer demand. This will increase profits and let her expand and improve her business and assist her family.

She is 32 years old, married and blessed with two children. They all live in Lagos state, Nigeria. She says thanks to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Los Capullitos Group

texts.es:
Gisela es una socia responsable del grupo ella se dedica al alquiler D. mototaxi hace varios años, su esposo es chofer D. transporte público él la apoya con los gastos en casa, ellos desean tener mayores ingresos, es por eso que Gisela es responsables en el grupo y la escogieron presidenta.

Para Nerea nunca es tarD. el estudio, así que ella está estudiando en la Universidad para luego poner en práctica lo que aprendió, además se dedica al comercio D. tablas para skateboard, ropa, zapatillas y zapatos en un stand que adquirió con mucho esfuerzo. Ella está satisfecha con lo que hace y  tiene el apoyo D. su familia.
 La Alcancía Comunal LOS CAPULLITOS cursa el 7mo Ciclo demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos. Los socios agradecen a cada una D. las personas que hacen posibles sus préstamos.
texts.en:
Gisela is a responsible group member who has leased out a mototaxi (three-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo) for several years; her husband is a public transportation driver and he helps out with household expenses. They would like to have more income and this is why Gisela is so responsible in the group and she was chosen group president. For Nerea it’s never late to study so she is studying in the university so that later she can put into practice what she’s learned. She also sells skateboards, clothing and shoes in a stand that she got with much effort. She is content with what she does and her family encourages her. The LOS CAPULLITOS (Little Flower Buds) communal bank is in its 7th loan cycle and they have been responsible and punctual with their repayments. The members are grateful to each person who has maD. their loans possible.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products.

loans.name: Chandrakanthi

texts.en:
Chandrakanthi  is a 48-year-old married woman living in Hikkaduwa, Galle, with her three sons and husband. Chandrakanthi has been managing her business by herself, which consists of selling grocery items. She purchases the items wholesale, then later sells them retail. She devotes her full effort to her grocery business, step by step, and uses the income to help support her family, which her husband and children also provide some support to. 

Chandrakanthi has managed her business for five years now, running it herself. She has asked for a 30,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka in order to purchase grocery items to sell.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more vegetables for her husband's business

loans.name: Semilla Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer Panamericana, se reúne la Asociación Comunal SEMILLA.
Su presidenta es la señora Mercedes T. de 42 años, se dedica a tejer mantas hace 12 años, al inicio solo se dedicaba al hilado pero con el pasar del tiempo incursionó en el tejido con el préstamo que esta solicitando ella tiene planificado comprar lana y producir más prendas.
Las demás integrantes de ésta Asociación tienen diferentes negocios como la venta de pollos, costura de buzos, venta de ropa, venta de comida y carne, todas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, insumos o materia prima, según el negocio que tengan
texts.en:
The association SEMILLS meets in one of the centers of Pro Mujer Panamericana. Their president is Mrs. Mercedes T., who is 42 years old. She has been making traditional woven cloths for 12 years. At first she only spun the yarn, but with time she began to weave as well. With this mircocredit loan, she plans on buying wool to make more cloth. The other members of the association specialize in various things such as selling chickens, sewing sweatshirts, selling clothes, selling food and meat, but all of them need the loan in order to acquire more merchandise, supplies or prime materials, depending on their speciality.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase prime materials

loans.name: Sok Phall's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok Phall R. is 60 years old and is the village bank president for a group which consists of nine members, located in Preak Anchanh village in Kandal province. The members of this village bank loan will use it to support their different purposes, and they also hope to increase their income to improve their families' living conditions, too. 

Mrs. Sok Phall R. is a congee seller and her husband, Mr. Phall Kim, is owns a Khmer trailer for a taxi driver. With both these businesses they can earn a small income to support themselves. Thus in order to increase their income and improve their standard of living, Mrs. Sok Phall R. decided to ask for a loan to buy mangoes for her new business. 

This couple does not have any children.

loans.use: To buy mangoes

loans.name: Afi Ame

texts.fr:
Agée de 34 ans, A. afi est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Pour contribuer aux charges du ménage, elle tient une épicerie. Dans sa boutique dénommée « Epicerie Centrale », elle  vend des épices, cubes en gros et en détail.
Elle a débuté cette activité en 2005 et la maitrise assez bien.
Le présent crédit a pour objet l’achat d’épice et d’ails pour les besoins de son commerce.
texts.en:
A. Afi, age 34, is married and the mother of two children. To help with the family's expenses, she runs a grocery store. In her shop, called "Epicerie Centrale", she sells spices, and bouillon cubes, wholesale and retail. She started this business in 2005, and now masters it quite well. The loan she's seeking will be used to buy spices and garlic for her store.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spices and garlic

loans.name: Benkadi Vii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres groupe BENKADI VII  sont des femmes mariées du village de Ziekan  de San, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali), qui   vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ayant en moyenne 37 ans et au moins 7 enfants. Elles cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe  Ziekan ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les deux  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
NIONI K. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants, exclusivement  au grand marché de Kimparana. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana. Les ventes se font également à  M’peresso et  dans les  marchés  environnants en détail (souvent en gros) au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 25 000 à 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi VII group are married women from the village of Ziekan of San, a region in Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mal) who live in traditional families, are 37 years old on average and have at least 7 children. They raise peanuts. In order to make their agricultural business profitable, the members of the Ziekan group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program three years ago. Having fully paid back their previous two loans, they are on their third farm loan. Nioni K. expects to use her loan to buy a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, small tools and input materials, exclusively from the large market in Kimparana. After the rainy season, the crops are stored for a time to be valued before being sold at the large market in Kimparana. The sales are made both in M’peresso and in the surrounding market at retail (often at wholesale) for cash to a customer base that generally comes from large cities. After the sale of their agricultural products, the members of the group each expect to make a profit of between 25,000 and 45,000 FCFA which will be used to repay the interest on the loan and for the everyday expenses of the family.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of input materials, seeds and small tools.

loans.name: Siavii

texts.en:
Siavii E. is 50 years old and married with 6 children between the ages of 7 and 25.  She owns a business venture, providing new clothing services to local community members.  She has four years of experience in this business.  

Siavii needs a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase additional fabrics and materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be about $150 per week) to improve the business.

In 2007, Siavii joined SPBD, and this is her 4th loan with them. SPBD's loans are Siavii's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD:

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD, and since then it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
A dedicated member of ASHI since 2009, Primitiva has been a model member, demonstrating regular attendance at weekly meetings and timely repayments of loans. Since joining ASHI, she has gained more self-confidence as a businesswoman and entrepreneur managing her own venture.

Primitiva buys and sells “amakan” (a word which, in the Antiqueño dialect, refers to woven bamboo strips that are used to dry rice under the heat of the sun). She started this business after joining ASHI. She has built a loyal base of customers in her neighbourhood, and also wants to sell her stock to other provinces. In partnership with her husband, Lino, she transports her products to other provinces through “RORO", or roll on, roll of – a means of transport whereby vehicles that carry passengers and products, particularly buses, roll onto a barge to travel across the ocean and roll off once their destination is reached. 

Primitiva wants to request a much larger loan to support the needs of her business and at the same time to continue its operation. With her passion for giving her family a brighter tomorrow, she will be eager to work hard and help her husband to meet her family’s needs. 

Primitiva’s business has been very helpful in achieving her dreams for her family. Her greatest hope is that her family will be able to have a decent way of life. Her long term goals are to help support her children, to improve her family’s living conditions by investing in and building a better house, and to have a successful business, including a small warehouse for storing the “amakan” she and her husband sell.

loans.use: to support the needs of her business and at the same time to continue its operation

loans.name: Leonilo

texts.en:
Leonilo A. is a single man who lives in Purok 2, Brgy. Cangmating, Sibulan, Negros Oriental. He earns his living by operating 2 businesses, a tricycle transport and a general store. Leonilo joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because he hoped for something better for his family. With the help of his past 7 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Leonilo has been incrementally lifting his family out of poverty by the sweat of his brow. His previous loan of 17,000 PHP helped him earn a monthly profit of 4,500 PHP, raising his standard of living.

For his 8th loan, Leonilo is borrowing 17,000 PHP, which he intends to use to purchase stock for his general store so that he can continue to save up for the future extension of his store and to buy a new motorcycle. Leonilo A. is a Dungganon man who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of his dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase stock

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman L. is a mother of two daughters, Iman was widowed and had to depend on her self to take care of her small family. Luckily, Iman started a small tailoring workshop in her house, which has become the household's only source of income since her husband passed away.

Iman took a couple of loans from FATEN to improve her workshop and now is taking a $500 loan to purchase a new tailoring machine. Iman's daughters work with their mother in the workshop where Iman appears in the picture above.

loans.use: Purchase a tailoring machine

loans.name: Bahodir

texts.en:
G. Bahodir is a farmer. He grows onions, potatoes, and other vegetables to support his family. He is 37 years old and has three children. He is worried about earning enough money to sustain his 1-hectare farm. His wife supports him in all his decisions. Together, they work hard to raise their children well. He has been tilling the land for 12 years. Bahodir is asking for a loan of 4000 Somoni that will be used to buy more seeds and fertilizer. The loan will enable him to have an abundant harvest.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history. It hosted a key post along the Silk Road and marked the extent of Alexander the Great's empire. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The country's civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients present viable business propositions. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: La Sra. Francisca se dedica a la venta de abarrotes (harina, fideo, pan. Soda, cerveza. Dulces, detergentes y otros, empezó su tienda desde muy pequeñita ahora ya esta mas surtida el crédito que solicito es para comprar otro estante y llenarlo de mercadería para la venta, Ella tiene 3 hijos por los cuales ella esta todo el día en casa de donde le surgió la idea de poner un kiosco. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de ropa de medio uso en el mercado Los Lotes donde no le fue muy bien pero no se desanimo y ahora es dueña de su propia venta, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Señora Francisca makes a living by selling groceries (flour, noodles, bread, soft drinks, beer, sweets, detergent, etc.).  She started her store when she was very young, and now that it is better stocked, she is requesting a loan to buy another display case and to fill it with merchandise to sell.  She has 3 children, which is why she is at home every day and why she had the idea to start a kiosk.  She is a very enterprising woman.  She previously sold used clothing in the Los Lotes markets.  It didn't go very well, but she didn't lose hope, and now she is the owner of her own business. She is very thankful to the organization for the support they have given her.

loans.use: To buy a display case

loans.name: Marlon Jose

texts.es:
MARLON JOSE J. B., Trabajo como  Conductor de la Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería. ES padre de familia de dos hijos y uno se encuentra en edad escolar, ha trabajado cuatro prestamo con ceprodel y estos han sido pra el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
el prestamo solicitado es para la compra de materiales de construccion para construir un cuarto en su casa de habitacion.
texts.en: Marlon Jose J. B. works as a driver at the National Engineering Univerity.  He is the father of a family with two children, one of which is school-age.  He has worked with CEPRODEL to receive four loans, which have all been used to make home improvements.  He is requesting this loan to buy construction materials to build a room onto his house.

loans.use: to make home improvements; to build a room

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: La señora  Maritza vive en la zona de Alto Lima el es de familia humilde tiene dos hijos pequeños su esposo trabaja en el área técnica independientemente. La señora pertenece al banco de emprendimiento Santiago Querido, el crédito desembolsado lo destino al aumento de capital ella vende colchas y camas en las puertas de los locales de fiestas como ser matrimonios, graduaciones, bautizos y otros, también utilizo parte de ello a una refacción de su casita en un muro,  muy responsable  con sus obligaciones cuenta con mejores expectativas para poder lograr mejorar condiciones de vida a futuro
texts.en: Maritza lives in Alto Lima district.  She is from a humble family.  She has two small children and her husband works in a technical field independently.  Maritza belongs to the “Santiago Querido” communal bank.  The loan she received  was used to increase her working capital.  She sells quilts and bed sets in the doorways of buildings which host events such as weddings, graduations, baptisms, etc.  She also used part of the money to refurbish one of the front walls of her house.  Maritza is very responsible in her obligations and has better prospects for improving her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To increase working capital and infrastructure

loans.name: Blanca Ofelia

texts.es:
Doña Blanca tiene 49 años D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. ropa, es viuda y vive con su hijo quien ya tiene su propia familia, residen en San Miguel, a doña Blanca la necesidad D. recibir ingresos la obligo prácticamente a recurrir al negocio y lo administra desD. hace 15 años luego D. que quedara viuda.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para compra ropa nueva y así ofrecer a los clientes en esta época que se acerca D. Fin D. año, este préstamo ayudara a incrementar el negocio a tener mayor posibilidades D. ganar dinero y ver el desarrollo del comercio.
Sueña con tener algún día la solvencia económica para invertir en el negocio y no a través D. préstamos.
texts.en:
Blanca is 49 years old and sells clothes.  She is a widow and lives with her son who already has his own family.  They live in San Miguel.  Blanca needed to generate her own income after becoming a widow 15 years ago, so she started a business which she has run ever since.

Blanca is requesting a loan to buy new clothes to offer to her customers in this end-of-year season which is fast approaching.  This loan will help her to increase her business and proviD. her with more opportunities to make money and see her business develop.

Blanca dreams of some day having enough capital to invest in her business without having to have recourse to loans.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José, de 43 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Sonia de 43 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. Los largos días de trabajo que José tiene en sus chacras, le han hecho ver que tiene que trabajar muy duro para lograr una buena calidad en sus cultivos. Todas las mañanas, junto a los primeros rayos de sol, camina hasta sus chacras de cacao, café y hojas de coca, las  cuales están a una hora aproximadamente. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 25 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, ya que los químicos que usa son muy peligrosos. En adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar sus cultivos. Este es el décimo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente si desea acceder a otro crédito posteriormente. En su banco comunal, es un socio muy participativo. Con los dos mil doscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en: José, 43, is a very simple and happy man. He lives in his own house with his wife Sonia, 43, and his 3 beloved children to whom he wishes to give a better future. The long work days that Jose has on his farms have made him see that he must work very hard to achieve good quality crops. Every morning, at the first rays of sunlight, he walks to his cocoa, coffee, and coca leaf farms approximately one hour away. What he most likes about his work is cultivating his land, and he does it with a lot of care. He has been doing this activity for 25 years and considers the most difficult to be spraying his land as the chemicals he uses are very dangerous. In the future, he hopes to buy new land in order to extend his crops. This is the tenth loan with MFP, and he knows he has to pay his installments punctually if he wants to access another loan later. He is an active member in his communal bank. With the two thousand two hundred soles he is requesting, he will buy more fertilizer for his crops.

loans.use: To buy sacs of fertilizer for cocoa and coffe cultivation

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica O. sells smoked fish at Ankaful near Abura. She has received a primary level of education, is married and has four children. Her husband is an auto mechanic. Veronica has been selling smoked fish for four years. She is responsible for assisting her husband in paying the family's bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to process for sale. She hopes to reinvest the additional profit back into her fish business.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to process for sale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama B. is married and has 2 children. She has received a junior high school education. Ama has been selling palm oil, which she produces herself from palm fruits, in Abrafo, near Abura, for the past year. Her husband is a mechanic. Ama is responsible for paying part of the cost of her children's school fees and books. She also supports her husband in taking care of the family's financial affairs.

Ama's loan will be used to purchase more bags of palm fruits in order to produce more palm oil. Her hope is to gain more customers when she offers larger quantities of oil. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to sell her goods on a more regular basis and to be better prepared for possible unpredictable events.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of palm fruits to produce palm oil

loans.name: Edward Machang'a

texts.en:
Edward Machang’a W. is 31-years-old, married to Njeri and they are blessed with two children. He has been selling computers and offers other services related to computers, like repairs, for six years. His profit margin is 7,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month. His business is located in Nairobi's central business district, which has a heavy concentration of offices; hence, is good for computer sales and services.

Edward was introduced to KADET by an old client and he is applying for a loan of 25,000 KES. He plans to buy spare parts for computers with 10,000 KES and one computer for 15,000 KES. He will add more stock with the profit and eventually open a big computer shop. He wants to offer his children better education.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and one computer

loans.name: Siilegmaa

texts.en:
Siilegmaa, 40, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Hentiy province in Mongolia. Her husband drives a taxi and her two children attend a local secondary school. They live in a regular house and have a decent standard of living. 

Siilegmaa began a clothing trading business in 2006. In the beginning, she sold clothing at a trading center, but now she rents a stall at a local outdoor market. Her daily net income is 60,000-80,000 MNT, which goes up to 100,000-120,000 during special days like public holidays. Her husband's daily net income is 10,000 to 15,000 MNT. Both of them have regular customers and now they have two vehicles, a truck and a car. 

Siilegmaa's current working capital is 2,500,000 MNT and she wants to expand it in order to buy an apartment.  She is a hardworking and honest person. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more clothing for her business and buy spare parts for her husband's car.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to resell

loans.name: Sonia Rocio

texts.es:
Sonia D.  de 38 años de edad  vive en el guasmo escogió esta actividad ya que ella tenía un capital guardado de su anterior trabajo y se dedica a la venta de productos confiteca, analecsa. 
 
Unas de sus obstáculos es la delincuencia ya que es comerciante por pedido. Está casada tiene 3 hijos 13, 11 ,11 y estudian en escuela fiscal y su esposo trabaja en lo mismo. Con el préstamo va a comprar productos de confiteca y anelecsa. Unas de sus metas es poder llegar con sus productos inalecsa a luagares que ella no puede llegar.
texts.en:
Sonia D. is 38 years old and she lives in Guasmo. She started this business with savings she had from a previous employment. She sells Confiteca and Analesca brand products. 

One of the obstacles she faces is unpaid orders. She is a merchant who sells by taking orders. She is married and she has 3 children, aged 13, 11 and 11 years old. They are in school and her husband works in the same business as her. With the loan she will purchase Confiteca and Analesca brand products. One of her goals is to take her products to locales where she cannot currently reach.

loans.use: To purchase sweets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chickens and poultry feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items for his ready-made items business

loans.name: Ryan

texts.en:
Ryan T. is from the village of Brgy. Roxas,Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 21 years old. Ryan is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Ryan owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ryan has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP per harvest, or every five months, for these activities.

In 2011, Ryan joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ryan is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ryan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline B. is from the village of Estefania, Amulung, Cagayan. She is 57 years old. Evangeline is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Evangeline joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 33000 PHP which will be used to purchase stock of products such as soap, condiments, canned goods and soft drinks. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Evangeline from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase inventory of products such as soap, condiments, canned goods and soft drinks.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella B. is from the village of Casinglot, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 54 years old. Bella is married and has eight adult children. To make a living, Bella owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, beverages, snack foods, shampoo, soap & biscuits in the local community. She also butchers pigs for deliveries at houses for credit & also provides ice cubes for school canteen businesses. Bella has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Bella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bella is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and as working capital for her business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Bella from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and provides working capital for her business.

loans.name: Erwin

texts.en:
Erwin is from the village of Malagana, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. He is 54 years old. Erwin is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Erwin owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, beverages, junk foods, shampoo, soap & biscuits in the local community. Erwin has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Erwin joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Erwin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Erwin is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & beverages. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Erwin from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & beverages.

loans.name: Tessito Faraya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 18 juin 2002. Il est composé de 07 femmes qui habitent le même quartier et ont pratiquement la même ambition (le développement de leur terroir). Le petit commerce et la culture de patate douce est leur activité principale.

Madame Mouskéba qui est à la gauche de la photo levant la main est le responsable du groupe. elle est âgée de 39 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants.

Elle s'active dans la vente de poisson frais et de nettétou. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine qu'elle pratique depuis plus d'une décennie.

Ce prêt lui permettra d'augmenter son capital et de mieux développer ses activités.

les profits lui permettront d'aider sa famille et ses enfants dans l'amélioration des conditions de vie(santé, nourriture etc...).
texts.en:
The solidarity group was created 18 June 2002. It consists of seven women living in the same neighborhood with virtually the same goal (to develop their land). Their main activities are small retail businesses and cultivating sweet potatoes.

Ms. Mouskéba - who is raising her hand on the left of the photo - is the group leader. She is 39 years old, married with three children.

She is active in the sale of fresh fish and nettétou (traditional West-African condiment). She has good experience in this field where she has been practicing for over a decade.

This loan will enable her to increase her capital and to further develop her activities.

The profits will enable her to help her family and her children by improving their living conditions (health, food, etc...).

loans.use: to buy fish and nettétou (traditional West-African condiment)

loans.name: Berna

texts.en:
Berna is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. Berna has a business selling fruits and vegetables, which she has run for one year.
To help expand her business, Berna has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Berna hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself – for example, by buying clothes. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and work in a big market.
Berna is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by generating more capital from her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene tiene 38 años reside en la localidad de Huaylahuicha. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer luchadora, vive en casa de su madre, quien le ayuda a cuidar de sus 2 queridos hijos, Joselin de 15 y Víctor de 12 años, a quienes quiere mucho. Su principal actividad económica es la agricultura, ahí trabaja arduamente, para que sus cultivos de lechuga, arveja, espinaca, cebollita china y papa, sean los más solicitados de su poblado. Todas las mañanas como hace 5 años; sin importar las condiciones del clima, sale a trabajar hacía sus chacras, ya que sabe que de ello dependen los ingresos que obtendrán por la venta de sus productos, que según cuenta tardan un promedio de 5 meses en madurar. Tiempo en que traslada su producción al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, para ser comercializado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, más le dificulta transportar sus productos hasta el mercado de la ciudad. Pero eso no la desanima, ya que traslada sus sembríos de espinaca a la capital donde obtiene mayores ganancias. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras para incrementar su producción y así obtener una camioneta con las ganancias que obtendrá. Todo esto pensando en el futuro de sus hijos, a quienes desea pagarles la carrera universitaria. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Victoria” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de la colaboración de todos ustedes para lograr sus objetivos. Con el compromiso de pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, por otro lado se siente feliz de pertenecer a una asociación que le ayude a crecer. Marlene de obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de semilla de arveja y varios sacos de abono orgánico para comenzar con la siembra.
texts.en:
Marlene, 38, lives in the town of Huaylahuicha.  She is a hard-working woman and lives with her mother who helps care for her two lovely children, Joselin, 15, and Víctor, 12, whom she loves very much.  Her main business is agriculture, and she works hard to grow lettuce, peas, spinach, Chinese onions and potatoes, which are in most demand in her town.  Every morning, as she has been doing for five years no matter what the weather conditions were, she goes out to work on her land because she knows her income depends on sales of her produce, which takes an average five months to grow.  She then takes it to the wholesale market in the city of Tarma to be sold.  

What she likes most about her job is working the lands.  The most difficult part is getting her produce to market.  But she does not let this get her down, and she takes her spinach crop to the capital city where she can earn more money.  In the future she would like to buy more land to increase production and buy a truck with her earnings.  Everything is all based on her children's future, as she would like to put them through college.  She belongs to the communal bank "Victoria" and this is her second loan through MFP, where she counts on your support to help her grow.  Marlene plans to use the loan to buy pea seeds and several sacks of organic fertilizer to begin planting.

loans.use: To buy pea seeds and several sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 2 Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Unidas II se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, gracias a una de las miembros, quien contactó con una de las asesoras, para informarse sobre el programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada logró juntar a 17 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando ya en el 3° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
La Sra. Sixta se dedica a la venta de ropas, este trabajo la ha ayudado mucho a la hora de mantener su hogar, puesto que gracias a esto genera ingresos y le permite paliar los gastos que surgen. Ella manifiesta que todo el sacrificio que hace es por darle un mejor estilo de vida a su familia y a ella misma. Sueña con algún día tener un puesto donde exhibir sus ropas.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de ropas de invierno, ya que se viene la temporada de frió y quiere estar prevenida para lo que los clientes le soliciten.
texts.en:
“Mujeres Unidas II” (United Women II) is known as an excellent group of women from the city of Itá. Thanks to one of its members, who was contacted by one of the advisors, they learned about the Women Entrepreneurs Program. Once the group received the information, they were able to gather 17 women who are now working on their third loan cycle as part of the program.

Sra. Sixta sells clothing. This work has been a great help in maintaining her household. Thanks to the income she generates, Sixta is able to offset the expenses her family accumulates. She says that all of her sacrifice has enabled her and her family to live a better lifestyle. Sixta dreams of having a vending stall where she can display her merchandise.

She is requesting a loan to buy winter clothing since the weather is cold. Sixta wants to be prepared for whatever her customers may order.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothing.

loans.name: Kangnigan

texts.fr:
Kangnigan  est âgée de 34ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse. Il est papa de trois(03) enfants.

 Il est revendeur de glaçons et de pure water depuis 2009.Il s’approvisionne à Lomé et revend à kangnikopé un quartier de la ville.

Il sollicite ce premier crédit à Wages afin d’acheter un nouveau congélateur. Il emploie une personne qui l’aide dans son commerce pour mieux satisfaire la clientèle.
texts.en:
Kangnigan is 34 years old. He is married to a saleswoman. He is the dad of three children.

He has been retailing ice and purified water since 2009. He gets his supplies from Lome and resells in Kangnikopé, one of the city's districts.

He is requesting this first loan from Wages to purchase a new freezer. He employs one person who helps him in his trade to better satisfy his clients.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang (pictured above), 57, is a widow without children. She is a tailor and she is hired to put together fabric swatches. She lives in the area surrounding Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Neang is asking for a loan of $1,000 to rebuild the kitchen where she cooks because it’s old and breaks.

loans.use: To rebuild the kitchen where she cooks because it’s old and breaks.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a focused 44-year-old business woman. She is married and is blessed with 5 children. To make a living, she operates a grocery shop. She wants in the next 5 years to have moved into larger premises and to have tripled her turnover. She is requesting for a loan of 10000 Kenyan shillings to buy carrots, onions, tomatoes and bananas. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she can now save on a weekly basis.

loans.use: to buy carrots, onions, tomatoes and bananas

loans.name: Haidarboi

texts.ru:
Хайдарбой целеустремленный и честный человек. Более 6 лет он занимается купля продажей скот. Он начал свой бизнес с куплей продажей крупного рогатого скота и получил хороший прибыль. Приобретая грузовую автомашину, он начал заниматься транспортной услугой, а его отец помогает ему откармливать скот дома, когда он на работе. За полученные прибыли он недавно построил однокомнатный дом. На рынке ему все доверяет, и ценят его. Даже из Республики Киргизии к нему приезжает за покупками скот.  Хайдарбой хотел бы получить кредит в размере 1500$ США для покупки овец с целью расширения бизнеса. Он заранее хочет благодарит вас за вашу помощь и доброты. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Haidarboi is a goal-oriented and honest person.  He has been involved in buying and selling livestock for over six years.  He started his business with buying and selling cattle and made a good profit.  Having bought a truck, he started to provide transportation services.  His father helps him feed livestock at home, when Haidarboi is at work.  Haidarboi used his profits to recently build a one-bedroom house.  Everyone trusts and values him at the market.  Even people from the Kyrgyz Republic come and buy livestock from him.  Haidarboi wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1500 for the purchase of sheep in order to expand his business.  He wants to thanks you in advance for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Virginiah

texts.en:
Virginiah has been selling clothes and shoes for the last five years. She is separated and has two children, ages 7 and 14 years old. Virginiah has lived in Malindi town for the last 15 years. Malindi is a tourist destination town. The challenge Virginiah faces is when the town is in low season and she receives low sales and more competition from other sellers.

Virginiah has been a Milango client since June 2011. She heard about Milango from her friends and joined a self-help group. A loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings will help Virginiah restock her business with shoes and clothes so she can have enough sales to prepare some savings for her child who is entering high school next year. She will also be able to get a larger variety of items to sell. She plans to repay her loan and obtain a larger loan in order to open other centers where she can sell clothes and also employ other staff.

loans.use: to buy new stock of shoes and clothes

loans.name: Tamer

texts.en:
Tamer is a 24-year-old man from Marka, Amman, Jordan.

Tamer started his business some years ago from his home with only one sewing machine, then he expanded it by customizing a room to operate from.
Tamer is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to purchase cloth and materials for his business.

An aspiration of Tamer is to develop his business and do a maintainance on his house.

loans.use: To purchase cloth.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
