It is hard to be a single parent to five children, even when they are already adults. You still have to guide them and act as both mother and father to them. This is the experience of Mrs. Corazon O., a 57-year-old widow who lives in the village of Tuburan, in the town of Pontevedra, Negros Occidental. Four of her five children have their own families and earn their own living. The youngest is 21 years old and still lives with her while she is attending college.

Corazon has owned and managed a pottery business for more than 30 years. She has a loyal clientele that patronizes her business because they know she produces high quality pottery in designs and colors that are suited to their taste.  But being successful can sometimes create problems - good ones!  Because of the high demand for her products, she ran short on working capital.  She did not want to miss the opportunity to expand her business, and this is the reason why she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 - to have access to additional capital when she has large orders that require a lot of raw materials.

In addition to her pottery business, she diversified and opened a cafeteria so that she could earn additional income. In the five years that she has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has maintained her good credit performance, and she earns on average a net profit of PHP5000 per month. Her last loan of PHP14000 was fully paid on time.  Now on her 9th loan cycle, she is borrowing PHP15000 to infuse more working capital into her business ventures. Her main objective now is to have her youngest son graduate from college and start his own life. Corazon is also starting to save for herself so that she will not be a burden to her children when she grows old.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To expand her business ventures.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi de Miria sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 30 ans et 3 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de Konobougou, sous préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et exercent le petit commerce d’articles divers. Ces femmes ont intégrés  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives. Elles sont à leur septième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter,  7 sacs de céréales, 30 sacs de charbon de bois et beaucoup d’autres articles dans les villages environnants qui seront revendus sur place à Konobougou, en détail, au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 32 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités. 
Elles ambitionnent diversifier leur commerce en embrassant d’autres activités génératrices de revenus.

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers.

loans.name: Sayda

texts.en:
Our client is Sayda.  She is part of a communal bank consisting of eleven neighbors who live in the San Sebastián district of Cusco.  The group is called Maria Auxilladora, named after a virgin saint of Peru.  She is a native of Kosñipata.

Sayda is 27 years old.  She lives with her partner and child.  She has completed secondary school.  She works as a “preventista,” which means she ensures that stores have the products they need to sell. In this case, she sells gas canisters.  Her business is located in the Industrial Park of Cusco.  With the loan, she will continue to work as a “preventista”, selling gas canisters to stores.

Sayda appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to make the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Augment her business of selling and refilling gas canisters

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Juana Francisca B. D. P. D. 42 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador con su familia que está compuesta por su esposo y sus tres hijos todos estudiantes. Juana es una mujer que le pone mucho entusiasmo a todo lo que hace, a pesar que son tantos años en su negocio, ella manifiesta que lo hace con agrado ya que reconoce que gracias a su tortillería a logrado ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a sus hijos, son quince años los que tiene Juana al frete D. su negocio, mismos que ahora desea reactivar a través D. tu ayuda, otorgándolo este crédito, ya que Juana comprara mayor cantidad D. materia prima para distribuir sus tortillas.
texts.en:
Juana Francisca B. D. P. is 42 years-old and lives in the department of San Salvador with her family, maD. up by her husband and their three children, who are all students. Juana is a woman who is very enthusiastic about everything she does. Even after so many years working in her business, she maintains that she still does it gladly, as she recognizes that thanks to her tortilla shop she has been able to help her husband get their kids ahead. For fifteen years Juana has been at the helm of her business, and now she wants to revive it with your help and this loan. With the funds Juana will buy more raw material to make and distribute her tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for her business

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady T. est une jeune femme de 31 ans, mariée. Elle fait de l’élevage ovin et du petit commerce d’arachide, de haricot et d’oseille. Elle souhaite développer son activité et augmenter ses revenus financiers pour mieux participer aux dépenses de sa famille.
texts.en:
Khady T. is a young 31-year-old woman who is married. She raises sheep and has a small business involving peanuts, beans, and dried hibiscus flowers. She wishes to develop her business and to increase her financial income in order to participate further in covering family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To raise livestock and to run a small business

loans.name: Mosood

texts.en:
Mosood sells bags of beans to make a living in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. He is 50 years old and is married with three children. His wife is a fashion designer and she also supports the home.

Mosood has been in his business for a long time. The demand for his bags of beans is high in his community so he is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more bags of beans to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of beans to sell

loans.name: Phun

texts.en: Phun D., a modest local farmer, lives in the rural area outside of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is 47 and is married to Sim who is 47 and works as a fisherman. They currently have six teenage children; three of whom are employed and the remaining three are attending school. Phun D.’s husband has been using his old boat to assist in his work as a fisherman.  However, his work is frequently suspended due to his boat being broken down. As a result of this challenge, Phun D. is applying for a loan to purchase another boat.

loans.use: To purchase a boat

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna M. is from the village of Tabuan, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 46 years old. Myrna is married and has three young children. To make a living, Myrna operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle services to local community members. Myrna has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month from these activities. In 2009, Myrna joined GDMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the first loan taken out by Myrna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Storage and sale of grains

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara is 39 years old. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports their home. Her eldest child is 17 years old. Her children are doing well in their school work. She sells text books to make a living in Lagos State, Nigeria. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She is hoping for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more text books to sell. She is, indeed, grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more text books to sell

loans.name: Anavita

texts.es:
Anavita C. A., tiene la edad de 41 años, está casado, tiene 3 hijos que son su mayor  prioridad. Ellos tienen 23,21 y 17 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para comprar un lote y poder sembrar granos básicos como los frijoles, maíz, además de sembrar plátano. La idea es  darle mantenimiento  al terreno para poder darle el adecuado mantenimiento a la siembra de granos básicos, y la siembra de plátanos, para cuando estén listos para cosechar los puedan vender y obtener mayores ganancias.  No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Anavita tiene muchos años de experiencia en la agricultura, sobre todo en la siembra de granos básicos, ella está segura de que le va a ir muy bien en el nuevo proyecto.Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Anavita C. A. is 41 years old, married, and has three children who are her highest priority. They are 23, 21, and 17 years of age. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a plot of land for growing beans and corn, as well as bananas. Her plan is to maintain the land so that she can adequately care for her crops until they are ready to be harvested and sold so that she can generate more income. This is not the first time she has received a loan from FUDECOSUR and she has been very happy with all of the services that have been provided. Doña Anavita has several years of experience in agriculture, mostly growing basic grains. She expects to do well in her next project. In the future, she hopes to provide her family with a better quality of life and greater financial stability. She also hopes to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a plot of land for growing beans, corn, and bananas

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es:
El señor Dionisio Q. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Tacagua, de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Dionisio trabaja como chofer de transporte de carga y su esposa es empleada de limpieza, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la refacción de la cocina y la instalación de gas a domicilio, con lo que disminuirá sus gastos familiares.
Esta es la séptima vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Dionisio Q. lives in his own house in the Tacagua area of the city of La Paz. He works as a driver transporting cargo. His wife is a cleaning lady. Their incomes support their family. The requested loan is to repair the kitchen and install gas in his home, which will decrease the family expenses. This is the seventh time he has requested a loan. The evaluation that was conducted qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the kitchen and install gas in his home

loans.name: Geremias

texts.es:
Geremias tiene 44 años D. edad, es separado y vive junto a sus tres hijos en L. ciudad D. Chepén, perteneciente a L. provincia del mismo nombre, en L. región L. Libertad. Ubicada a una hora D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. L. región Lambayeque.

DesD. hace quince años se dedica a L. reparación y mantenimiento D. llantas y neumáticos D. todo tipo D. vehículos (servicio D. vulcanizado). Este negocio es L. unica fuente D. ingreso por lo que siempre da todo D. si para salir adelante. El establecimiento queda ubicado en los exteriores del mercado D. L. ciudad D. Chepén y cuenta con todos los permisos para su funcionamiento.

Geremias desea adquirir unos repuestos y dale mantenimiento a las máquinas que utiliza D. modo que pueda realizar su trabajo D. un modo mas eficaz. Por ello se ha visto en L. necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Geremias es una persona muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos y conocidos, ellos dan buenas referencias D. el y lo consideran una persona bastante responsable, trabajadora y que siempre da todo D. si para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Geremis is 44 years old. He is separated and lives with his three children in the city of Chepén. Chepén belongs to the province of the same name, in the L. Libertad region, located one hour from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. For fifteen years he has worked at the repair and maintenance of wheels and tires of all types of vehicles. This business is his only source of income because he puts all his effort into it. His business site is located outsiD. of the Chepén city market and has all the permits that are required. Geremias wants to purchase some spare parts and service his business machinery in order to work more efficiently. For this reason, he realized the need to request for the first time a loan of $700 from Edpyme Alternativa. Geremias is well-known and respected by his neighbors and acquaintances. They give him good references and consider him very responsible, hard-working, and a man who gives everything to his business and the hope of greater prosperity.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies and maintenance of equipment to improve his tire repair business

loans.name: Saren

texts.en:
Mrs. Saren C. is a 23-year-old married woman and she is a villager who lives in Trapeang Khnaor village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 1.20-hectare (3-acre) field on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Vuthy Noem, is a firewood seller who is able to earn a small income to support his family.

Although they try to work hard with their businesses, they still earn less income than needed to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Saren C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve her family living.

This couple has three children, one of whom is attending the local school, while the other two are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Afroditas Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer Exaltación, se reúne la Asociación Comunal AFRODITAS, con 8 integrantes 

Una de las integrantes es Marina Luz de 24 años, casada y vecina de la zona Ciudad Satélite.
Marina tiene el negocio de venta de masitas, hace 3 años aproximadamente y necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos como la harina, azucar y otros.
 
Las demás integrantes de éste grupo cuentan con variados negocios como la venta de artefactos, cosméticos, tejido de chompas, venta de comida, costura de chamarras y venta de productos naturales.
 
Todas necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería o materia prima según el negocio que tengan.
texts.en:
The 8-member AFRODITAS (Aphrodites) communal association meets at one of Pro Mujer Exaltación’s focal centers. One of the members is Marina Luz, 24. She’s married and lives in Ciudad Satélite. She ha sold masitas (a typical pastry) for about three years and needs funds to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, etc. The other members of the group have various commercial activities like the sale of crafts, cosmetics, sweater knitting, food sales, jacket making and sales of natural products. They all need funds to buy ingredients or raw materials for their various businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase gas stoves for his shop

loans.name: Sao Dy

texts.en: Sao Dy S., 44, lives in Tralach village, in Takeo province.  She is a farmer who owns two hectare of land to cultivate rice.  Aside from farmer she is also a pig breeder.  Sao Dy decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seeds to support her farm and to buy pig food for pig breeding.  Her husband, Sophal, is a tax officer. This couple has four children; who all are students who support their mother's businesses.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, rice seeds ans pig food.

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
The woman in the photo, Mrs. S., 22, is a villager who lives in a rural area of Siem Reap Province. She and her husband are fishermen. They depend on fishing in and around the river, which is the main place where fish are found. This couple normally generates an income of US$ 4 a day to resolve their family’s financial crises or to buy food for their two children, who are still young and under their care. 

Recently, this couple has not been able to catch as much fish due to the lack of essential fishing implements. Because they don't have money, S. is asking for a loan to buy a net, a trap, and a boat for their fishing activities.

loans.use: To buy a net, trap, and a boat for their fishing activities

loans.name: Elsita Edilta

texts.es:
Elsita de 31 años, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil, (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución). Su esposo es chofer y tienen dos hijos de 11 y 10 años. Ella era ama de casa pero como no podía ayudar a su esposo económicamente decidió vender víveres en su casa, poco a poco con esfuerzo compro mas víveres y vitrinas. 

Ahora ella tiene una tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, cuando sus hijos llegan de la escuela le ayudan. Ella trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. Gracias a los ingresos que ha tenido en la tienda ha podido mantener a sus hijos en mejores condiciones económicas por eso ella quiere seguir comprando víveres y con el préstamo comprar arroz, azúcar y enlatados. 

En el futuro quiere mejorar el estudio que tienen sus hijos, y surtir mas su tienda.
texts.en:
Elsita is 31 years old and lives in the Fortín de Guayaquil, (a peri-urban zone in a deteriorating ecosystem). Her husband is a chauffeur and they have two children, ages 10 and 11. She was a homemaker, but could not financially help her husband so she decided to sell food at home. With her efforts she has gradually bought more food and showcases. Now she has a store in the front of their home, and when the children get home from school they help out. She works daily from 6:00 am - 10:00 pm. Thanks to the revenue from the store, she has been able to maintain good economic conditions for her children. Because of this, she wants to continue buying food. With the loan she will buy rice, sugar and canned goods. In the future she wants to improve her children’s studies and restock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Dina Bach, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Edith Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. Edith del Carmen Rodríguez A. es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos y reside en la colonia Santa Ana de Jamastran en Danli, El Paraiso. 

La Sra. Edith es una madre empresaria que tiene su propio negocio que opera bajo el nombre de Pulperia "Edith". En su tienda general, la Sra. Edith vende gran variedad de productos con enfoque en los de consumo diario, por ejemplo: Azúcar, Arroz, Café, pollo, maseca, manteca, huevos, etc.

Con el prestamo, la Sra. Edith comprara azúcar, Arroz, Café, pollo, Maseca, Manteca, Huevos, Pan, Jabon, Papel Higienico, Churros, Harina de Trigo, Confites, Pasta Dental, Toallas Sanitarias, Galletas, Pastillas, Desinfectantes, Candelas, Fosforos, Baterias y Fresco en Polvo.

La Sra. Edith utilizara las ganancias incrementales que obtendra de su negocio para continuar pagando los gastos escolares de sus hijos y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Edith del Carmen Rodríguez A. is the single mother of two children. She lives in the Santa Ana de Jamastran neighborhood of Danli, El Paraiso. Ms. Edith is an enterprising mother who has her own business, which she runs under the name, “Pulperia Edith” (Edith’s General Store). [She] sells a large variety of products in her store, and focuses on daily consumables, such as sugar, rice, coffee, chicken, dough, lard, eggs, etc. Edith will use the money from this loan to buy bread, soap, bathroom tissue, churros, wheat flour, confectionary items, toothpaste, sanitary napkins, cookies, pills, disinfectant, candles, matches, batteries, and powdered air freshener.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: God Knows Us Group

texts.en:
Decontee E., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called 'God Knows Us'. Decontee is 24 years old, single, and has two children, 5 and 9 years old. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support. For 9 years, she has been operating a mini restaurant in Gbengba Town Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 6, 000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more meat, fish, cooking oil, onions, salt, etc.

She describes herself as an easy-going person. Her goal is to improve her business and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more meat, fish, cooking oil, onions, salt, etc.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita G. is from the city of San Jose Santiago. She is 54 years old. Carmelita is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Carmelita owns & operates a business selling watermelon. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Carmelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Carmelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old married woman from Lebanon. A mother of 2 young children, she started a business selling clothes and lingerie from her home in 2006. Today, she is the proud owner of a small clothing shop. She is asking for a loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve her store’s furnishings; she wants to purchase shelves and shop windows to present her clothes to her customers. She has been working hard in her store to achieve her goals. She hopes that with the new furnishings both her income and her sales volume will be increased.

loans.use: to purchase shelves and shop windows

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester V. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 47 years old. Ester is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Ester owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Ester has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ester joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ester has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ester is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Ester from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more 'lappas'

loans.name: Ilarion

texts.es: El señor Ilarion nacido en la Liras en la localidad de El Torno provincia Andrés Ibáñez a 15 Km de El Torno. El se dedica a la agricultura y corte de madera para los carpinteros. Ellos son 5 hermanos mayores y trabajan en la misma parcela, pero ellos se dedican más a la agricultura siembran maíz, arroz y maní sacan a la venta en el mercado de El Torno, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de una motosierra, para así facilitar su trabajo en el corte de madera, y el resto en la compra de semillas, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado. El Sr. Ilarion se encuentra en la foto en compañia de su esposa y su hijito.
texts.en: Ilarion was born in La Liras in the municipality of El Torno in the Andrés Ibáñez province, 15 kilometers from the city of El Torno.  He is a farmer and also cuts wood for carpenters.  He works with his 4 adult brothers on the same parcel of land, but they work more in agriculture cultivating corn, rice and peanuts.  They take their products to sell in the El Torno market.  He will use the money from this loan to buy a chainsaw, which will facilitate his work cutting wood, and to buy seeds.  He is very grateful to the institution for the support provided.  Ilarion is seen in the photo accompanied by his wife and their child.

loans.use: to buy a chainsaw and corn seed

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a loving mother and hard working entrepreneur determined to improve her family's standard of living. She joined Kiva partner ASHI in 2000 to gain access to loans to support her entrepreneurial dreams. The first few loans she received enabled her to support the family’s sewing business and resale of plastic items and Styrofoam. The profit from these businesses has been the main source of family's income.  

Yolanda is now asking for another Kiva loan for a much larger amount. This is her second loan from Kiva lenders. She repays her previous loan in full and on time. The capital will fund further expansion of the family ventures to support Yolanda’s dreams for her children and her grandchildren to have brighter hopes. 

With working funds Yolanda’s business will keep on growing and she will be able to offer fulfilling services to her customers. Through the support of ASHI and KIVA partner, she hopes to see herself and her family change their living conditions and moving forward out of the poverty level. 

Yolanda hopes of an expanded business, therefore she is requesting a loan of 45,000 pesos to pay for a variety of plastic materials, styrofoam and other supplies. Yolanda requests this loan through ASHI so that she can support the expansion of her business and be able to provide the growing demands of her customers. Her long term goal is to have a tailoring shop a year from now so that she can give the opportunity of  employment to others, especially extended relatives in her community. She also hopes to have her own van for business use and to invest more in her home. 

Yolanda hopes to maintain long-term sustainable businesses. During the course of her membership in ASHI, Yolanda has been a model member dedicated to managing her family’s operations.

loans.use: To pay for a variety of plastic materials, styrofoam, and other supplies.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio, de 44 años, convive con Benedicta, de 42 años. Ambos tienen 7 hijos, todos ellos menores de edad. Que con mucho amor y cariño lo educan en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad nativa Centro Huachirick (selva central peruana). En la comunidad nativa, Julio es muy respetado entre sus pobladores; su capacidad de palabra y su buen trato lo diferencian; pues él se desempeña como albañil. La construcción de las casas de la comunidad es producto de su ingenio y responsabilidad. Pero como todo hombre del campo. Julio se dedica, hace 15 años a la agricultura. El cultivo de café, palta y plátanos, son su principal actividad; los fines de semana, de cada 15 días, visita su platanal, ahí cosecha los plátanos que produce y los comercializa en el mercado central de la ciudad de Pichanki. Pero lo que más le gusta a Julio; es poder incursionar en la siembra intensiva, eso quiere decir; poder cosechar en mayores cantidades, por eso para más adelante está pensando adquirir más mamones (plantas pequeñas de plátano). Es el tercer crédito con MFP, por eso en cada reunión con su banco comunal, demuestra puntualidad en sus cuotas, así manifiesta el agradecimiento por su progreso. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá adquirir 2 mil plantaciones de café, con lo que podrá renovar sus plantaciones; los cuales cuidarán dentro de 2 a 3 años para que den fruto.
texts.en:
Julio, 44, cohabits with Benedicta, 42.  They have 7 minor children that they educate in their own home, located in the indigenous community of Centro Huachirik (Peruvian central jungle), with much love and affection.

Julio is highly respected by the residents of the indigenous community due to his trustworthiness and good way of dealing with people.  He works as a bricklayer and the construction of houses in the community is product of his ingenuity and responsibility.

However, like all men from the countryside, he’s been a farmer for 15 years.  His main crops are coffee, avocado and bananas.  On the weekends every two weeks he visits his banana fields where he harvests the bananas he produces to sell in the city of Pichanki’s central market.  What Julio enjoys the most, though, is going into intensive planting; that is, to be able to harvest in larger quantities.  This is why he’s planning to buy more baby banana plants.

This is his 3rd loan with MFP and why at every meeting of his communal bank he always shows punctuality with his payments; this is how he shows his gratitude for his progress.

He will use the requested loan to buy 2000 coffee plants to renew his fields.  These will be cared for for two to three years until they bear fruit.

loans.use: To buy 2000 coffee plants.

loans.name: Mien's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of four low-income people who live together in Siem Reap province. Mrs. Mien P. has been recruited to be the leader of this group by the other borrowers. She is 38, married, and the mother of five children. Four of her children are students. The other is no longer in school and is working as a porter. Mien P. currently earns her daily living by working as a carrying laborer in the local market, earning $3 each day. Her husband is also a porter in the same the market. The family’s living conditions are not comfortable because their house needs repairs. Mien P. is seeking a loan to make some improvements to her house.

The other three borrowers include: 
Mrs. Ren K., a fish porter, who is asking for a loan to repair her broken house.
Mrs. Am P. will use this loan for repairing her broken house.
Mrs. Hoat N. is applying for a loan to purchase more pigs and ducks to raise.

loans.use: To make some improvements to her house.

loans.name: Nonie

texts.en:
Nonie  V. is a 51-year old married woman who supports her family by operating a dried fish production business.  She lives in Roma, Barangay Batya, EB Magalona, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.  By working hard in her  dried fish production business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000. 

Nonie is now borrowing PHP 12,000 so that she can continue to fund the operations of her business.   This will be her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of PHP 12,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Nonie  aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.   

About NWTF:  
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through this program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operations of her dried fish production business

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es:
El Senor Juan Alberto S. es agriculto, tiene 41 anos de edad, originario de la Comarca El Quebracho, Miraflor, del Departamento de Esteli; soltero y tiene 5 hijos.
El nos relata que empezo ayudando a su Papa en las actividades agricolas, a la corta edad de 5 anos, abondono sus estudios en el 4to grado de primaria. A los 15 anos de edad ayudaba sembrar granos basicos y Papa.
En los anos 80 su Papa obtuvo del gobierno, un terreno, debido a la Reforma Agraria que hubo en esa epoca para que la trabajara como Patrimonio Familiar.
El solicito este credito, para la siembra de 1/2 manzana de Papa y compra de Insumos. El piensa que con este credito podra obtener mayores ingresos. Desea brindarles a sus hijos un mejor nivel de vida, por lo que esta apoyandolos para que estudien y que ellos puedan ser duenos de su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Juan Alberto S. is a 41 year-old farmer who is a native of the El Quebracho district of Miraflor, in the department of Esteli.  He is single and has 5 children.

He tells us that he started out working in agriculture with his father when he was only 5 years old.  He left school in the 4th grade.  At 15, he used to help his father cultivate staple grains and potatoes.

In the 1980s his father got some land from the government due to an agrarian reform program that existed during this period of time, which was designed to enable farmers to own their own land.

He requests this loan to sow a half-manzana (a little less than an acre) of land with potatoes, and to buy supplies.  He thinks that with this loan he will be able to have higher earnings.  He hopes to provide his children with a higher standard of living, so he is supporting them while they are in school.  He hopes that they can someday have their own businesses.

loans.use: to plant potatoes and buy supplies

loans.name: Corregidora I Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Corregidora 1 porque su calle lleva el mismo nombre, el cual es de un personaje de la Independencia de México y se identifican con ella, por su lucha constante y tenacidad. Esta ubicado en la ciudad de Pachuca en el estado de Hidalgo en México. El grupo está conformado por 8 integrantes.La Señora Juana D. es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 46 años de edad, estudió hasta tercero de secundaria, es comerciante y tiene en total 1 hija. Vende jugos de diferentes frutas en su domicilio particular. La señora Juanita se da a conocer con sus cliente por su  buen trato y amabilidad,  la conocen como una excelente persona. Ella inció desde hace 1 año su negocio, nos comentan sus clientes que prepara los jugos y desayunos con mucha higiene y que gracias a su amabilidad cada dia aumentan sus clientes.Está solicitando el prestamo para adquirir materia prima para introducir comida y antojitos mexicanos. En un futuro no muy lejano desea remodelar su local para aumentar sus ventas y así poder ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija  y  a su esposo.Sus clientes se enteraron de la elaboración de almuerzos al pasar por su domicilio ya que los exibe y pone anuncios ademas de la calidad que la distingue el lugar muy confortable y la calle muy transidada. La fotografia fue tomada en el interior del negocio  de la Presidenta del grupo Corregidora 1, se observa  la decoración del negocio y lo felices que se estan.
texts.en:
This group is called Corregidora 1 because its street has the same name, after an important figure in Mexico's Independence. They identify with him because of his constant struggle and tenacity. The group is in the city of Pachua, in Hidalgo state, Mexico. The group is made up of 8 members.
Mrs Juana D. is the group president. She is 46, and studied up to the third grade of secondary school. She is a merchant and has one daughter. She sells juices from different fruits in her home. Juanita is known by her customers for her good service and kindness; they know her as an excellent person. 

She started this business one year ago, and her customers tell us that she prepares her juices and breakfasts with a lot of hygiene, and that thanks to her kindness she has more customers every day. She is requesting  this loan to acquire basic material to start selling food and Mexican dishes. In the near future she wants to remodel her home in order to increase her sales and thus be able to offer her daughter and husband a better quality of life. Her customers find out about her food when they pass by her house, as she puts it on display and puts up signs. Her food is set apart by its quality, and her location is very comfortable. The street on which it is located is very well-trafficked. 

This photo was taken inside the business of the president of the Corregidora 1 group. One can observe the business' decor, and see how happy the group members are.

loans.use: to acquire basic materials to start selling food and Mexican dishes.

loans.name: Jiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe JIGUISSEME sont toutes mariés avec une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles monogames à MEDINE un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passé ont été remboursé dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de tissus et  des oranges à travers MAIMOUNA D.. 
MAIMOUNA D.  compte acheter avec son  prêt, 30 sacs d’oranges .
Elle s’approvisionne auprès des producteurs de SIKASSO. Les oranges sont revendus au  marché de MEDINE à Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et en détail. 
 Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 95.000 FCFA utilisée pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the group named Jiguisseme are all married and they are 42 years old on average. They each have 4 children. They live in monogamous families in Medine, a quarter in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region in Mali). 

They are on their ninth group loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner) and their goal is to satisfy their clients' needs. The previous loans were successfully repaid. This group of women sells fabrics and oranges through Maimouna D.. 

Maimouna D. plans on investing her loan in the purchase of 30 sacks of oranges. 

She purchases her products from the producers in Sikasso. The oranges are resold in the market in Medine, Sikasso, and to family. Her clientele is made up of men and women and she takes cash and credit. 

She plans on earning a monthly income of 95.000 FCFA and it will be used to supply her family's daily needs.

loans.use: To purchase oranges.

loans.name: Joey

texts.en:
Joey S. is from the village of San Isidro, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. He is 47 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Joey buys and sells green and yellow bananas in the local community. Joey has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2010, Joey joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services in hopes of improving his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joey has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Joey is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to buy additional bananas.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase green and yellow bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more bags of maize in order to produce her wares in larger quantities for sale

loans.name: Jannie

texts.en:
Jannie F. is from the village of TABOC SUR, OROQ. CITY. She is 39 years old. Jannie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jannie works in a family member's business venture in a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing transportation services to the local community. Jannie has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Jannie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jannie is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle and to purchase other accessories like raincoat for better services. This will be the first loan taken out by Jannie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle and to purchase other accessories like raincoat for better services

loans.name: Jeny

texts.es:
La señora Jenny Gómez es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien se dedica a la venta de ropa, cosméticos y chinelas desde hace 10 años. Su inicio fue irregular pero con el tiempos y su ardua labor se fue consolidando.
G. tiene cuatro hijos  de 12, 10, 8 y 5 años respectivamente e invertirá el crédito en mercadería para la temporada de verano.
texts.en:
Jenny Gómez is a hard-working, driven and enterprising woman who has been selling clothes, cosmetics and thongs (flip-flops) for 10 years.  Her first business steps were uneven but, over time and as a result of her hard work, her business has grown stronger.

Mrs Gómez has four children aged 12, 10, 8 and 5 and she will invest her loan in buying merchandise for the summer season.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Hadijja

texts.en:
Hadijja is a twenty-seven-year-old single mother with one child and  she rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. She is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after her child and her desire is to educate her child up to university.She has had a retail shop for five years and the business is at its break-even point. Her hardship is limited funds to meet the increasing demand of customers and her vision is to become a wholesaler and buildi a house.

Hadijja needs the loan facility to buy salt, sugar and maize flour to sell.

loans.use: To buy salt, sugar and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice is a farmer in Kitale in Western Kenya. He is 51 years old, and is married, with four children all below the age of nine. Maurice runs a "boda boda" (bicycle) transport business to supplement his farming income.

Maurice has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the income will sustain the family with food as well as help the family boost its other
businesses. He is focusing on expanding the dairy business significantly.

Maurice notes that poor state of the roads is a hindrance to business, especially his dairy business, since it results in wastage.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.
